boardgame.name: Manual of Skilled Trades
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Manual of Skilled Trades contains instructions and advice detailing the best practices of several trades and professions. The book itself serves as a player aid, and features a new magic item, 27 new feats, 3 updated feats, and rules for alcohol poisoning.

boardgame.name: Gryphon's Spellbook
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Gryphon's Spellbook contains a collection of spells cataloged by the wizardly scholar Magnus Rubeus Gryphon. The book itself serves as a player aid, and features a new magic item, 8 new feats, and 24 new spells.

boardgame.name: Grimoire of Eldritch Power
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Grimoire of Eldritch Power contains the eldritch workings of an otherworldly being. The book itself serves as a player aid, and features a new magic item, a new feat, 16 new Eldritch Invocations, and rules for gathering herbs while traveling.

boardgame.name: Orisons of the Nine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Orisons of the Nine contains the teachings of the church of the Sovereign Host. The book itself serves as a player aid, and features a new magic item, 2 new feats, 21 new spells, and lore about the Sovereign Host and the Dark Six.

boardgame.name: Shadowcraft
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The book Shadowcraft contains instructions and advice detailing the trade secrets of the subtle arts. The book itself serves as a player aid, and features a new magic item, 12 new feats, 20 new adventuring gear, 8 new weapons, and rules for advanced weapon training for the weapons included in this book.

boardgame.name: Seafarer's Handbook
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Form a crew of sailors to accompany you and your fellow adventurers on your journey across the sea. Each sailor performs a job, which help your ship and crew survive the journey. Along with the rules for running a crew of sailors, this book includes several character backgrounds, which facilitate player characters in contributing to a ship and crew. This book is intended to be used in conjunction with Dungeon Master's Journey Guide.

boardgame.name: Guide to Horror
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This guide has everything you needs to explore the themes of horror in Dungeons & Dragons. Included are rules for alcohol poisoning, rules for Stress Dice and stress points (which are analogous to Hit Dice and hit points), example of how to use Sanity as an ability score, options for creating characters using Sanity, and new feats pertaining to Sanity, stress points, and madness.

Trigger Warning: This book contains themes involving sanity, death, blood, addiction, alcohol, and sociopathy.

boardgame.name: Wayfarer's Handbook
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Form a caravan of travelers to accompany you and your fellow adventurers on your journey across the land. Each traveler performs a job, which help your caravan survive the journey. Along with the rules for running a caravan of travelers, this book includes several character backgrounds, which facilitate player characters in contributing to a caravan. This book is intended to be used in conjunction with Dungeon Master's Journey Guide.

boardgame.name: Lost Ruins of Arnak: Expedition Leaders – Folded Space Insert
boardgame.description:
Insert compatible with Lost Ruins of Arnak: Expedition Leaders, and adds additional trays which should be combined with our existing FS-LRA insert. The design provides both efficient storage and improved game play. The trays can be utilised during the game, and they greatly aid set-up and clear-away times.

The insert provides five new trays which replace the large # filler tray from FS-LRA.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Lost Ruins of Arnak: Expedition Leaders

boardgame.name: Dungeon Master's Journey Guide
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A caravan or crew exists to aid you, as Dungeon Master, and your players in telling epic stories. The journey can be as fun and engaging as the destination. Adventure, peril, and treasure await those willing to brave the uncharted lands, seas, skies, and underground of your campaign world when you use this guide. This book is intended to be used in conjunction with Wayfarer's Handbook and Seafarer's Handbook.

boardgame.name: Treatises of Kasshta
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Treatises of Kasshta is a collection of scrolls containing the treatises for various styles of martial arts. The book itself serves as a player aid, and features a new magic item and 21 new feats.

boardgame.name: Ark Nova: Folded Space Insert
boardgame.description:
Insert compatible with Ark Nova. The design provides both efficient storage and improved game play. Many of the trays can be utilised during the game, and they greatly aid set-up and clear-away times.

The trays are arranged in up to two layers. The card trays both have space for sleeved cards, and we have provided additional storage space for many more cards should they be released in the future.

boardgame.name: Dice Flower
boardgame.description:
Get secateurs, flannel shirts, vases and… gray matter! Play as the owner of one of a kind flower shop! Manage, plan, plant, cut and create beautiful, colorful bouquets. Don’t let the flowers and your growing ambition wither, to get as many Happiness Points as possible and win the competition. Are you ready to meet the demands of an endless queue of customers? Play and see for yourself!

Rool & write game with:

unique board layout in each game
deep and strategic gameplay
unique mechanics
high replayability


—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Core 5E Knowledge Quick Reference PDF
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A one-page quick reference PDF with useful rules and information for a smooth session! Ideal for both players and dungeon masters.

boardgame.name: Crown of the Oathbreaker
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Crown of the Oathbreaker is a dark adventure campaign taking characters from level 5 to 13. The adventure is set in multi-layered sandbox realms, in which the players will uncover dark secrets from the past of a royal family after the fall of a blessed era to break a curse that plagues the kingdom.

User summary:

This scenario is distributed as multiple files:

919-page scenario (US Letter)
107-page Kingdom of Aglarion Gazetteer
53-page Player Options
43-page map pack
254-page card set
archive of JPG digital maps

boardgame.name: D&D Unleashed: The Elements & Beyond
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A magical exploration of the four elements and the various energies of creation — minus those dark forces that belong in forbidden tomes — powers such as light, thunder, lightning, acid, frost, and the magic of nature!

boardgame.name: Artificer Subclasses: A Dark Fantasy Supplement
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Featuring the Machine Cultist and the Artificer Reanimator, these are two brand new Subclasses.

boardgame.name: Dragon Magic
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Explore now options and spell selections for the most fearsome monsters in Dungeons and Dragons! Dragon Magic is full of guidance on running dragons, selecting their spells, and using those spell to enhance their combat and roleplay potential.

Chapter 1 provides guidance to inform what spells dragons take, and reviews every type of dragon in the Monster Manual, listing specific spell options and how they can be used, alongside combat tactics and world-building ideas.

Chapter 2 presents six fully-fleshed out dragon NPCs, complete with backgrounds, roleplaying notes, and stat blocks. Each one is ready to be dropped into any D&D setting to serve as memorable friends, allies or villains!

boardgame.name: Eberron Battlemaps: Sharn Pack 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a collection of battlemaps suitable for Sharn in the Eberron
...
All maps are available in two version:
- 1" grid version for print and use with miniatures, etc.
- Gridless version for use with online services such as Roll20 or Fantasy Grounds

The maps include:
- 47"x 47" : Skybridge Shop & Workshop
- 54"x 54" : Skydock with 2 docked Skyships
- 41"x 41" : City Watch Precinct
- 45"x 45" : Skybridge Intersection
- 57"x 57" : Casino and music venue
- 49"x 49" : Part of the Bazaar

boardgame.name: Eberron Battlemaps: Sharn Pack 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is my second collection of battlemaps suitable for Sharn in the Eberron
...
All maps are available in two version:
- 1" grid version for print and use with miniatures, etc.
- Gridless version for use with online services such as Roll20 or Fantasy Grounds

The maps include:
- 30"x 25" : House Cannith production site/factory
- 30"x 40" : Lightning Rail station
- 20"x 20" : Skyway Manor
- 14"x 12" : Manor Top Level
- 14"x 12" : Manor Basement Level
- 20"x 20" : Tavern by the market
- 35"x 25" : Lower Sharn Tent Slums
- 49"x 49" : Part of the Bazaar

boardgame.name: Frendi Frokthu's Big Book of Fungi
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Are you running an Underdark adventure and want more versatility to the fungi found there? Are you playing a circle of spores druid and want more fungus themed spells? Are you a DM wanting to create an adventure involving Zuggtmoy by find yourself lamenting the lack of fungal monsters? Or maybe you're just like me and you love fungi? Well this supplement is for you!

This fully illustrated supplement is the product of a labor of love involving research into both the fungi of the Dungeons and Dragons multiverse and the fungi of the real world, bringing additional insight into the role that fungi play in the Forgotten Realms and beyond, all from the perspective of a friendly svirfneblin ranger!

boardgame.name: Frendi Frokthu's Big Book of Fungi: Character Options
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Are you running an Underdark adventure and want more versatility to the fungi found there? Are you playing a circle of spores druid and want more fungus themed spells? Are you a DM wanting to create an adventure involving Zuggtmoy by find yourself lamenting the lack of fungal monsters? Or maybe you're just like me and you love fungi? Well this supplement is for you!

User summary:

Intended for use with Frendi Frokthu's Big Book of Fungi.

boardgame.name: Frendi Frokthu's Comprehensive Catalogue of Spore Servants
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This product contains conversions of spore servants for every compatible monster within Monster Manual (D&D 5e). This supplement is a companion piece to Frendi Frokthu's Big Book of Fungi.

boardgame.name: Goat-Ball Expanded Rules
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Turn a game of goat-ball into a dramatic contest of physical feats, bold strategy, and high narrative stakes! The goliaths of Icewind Dale developed this pastime as a way for their communities to settle differences and blow off steam. Sometimes an impressive victory opens doors and earns respect more effectively than simple negotiation. Will your characters dominate the court, or suffer defeat at the hands of more capable players?

These expanded rules for the game of goat-ball turn the event into a full encounter or standalone minigame. Play with 2 or more teams, or go for the more aggressive 2-player duel.

This product includes expanded rules for the game of goat-ball, an example goat-ball court map, and a chart for generating team names.

boardgame.name: A Guide to Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This guide is intended to help DMs new and old alike prepare and run Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden. Inside is prep notes, a campaign outline, and a massive rundown of each chapter, with quick summaries and notes of things to avoid as you run the game.

boardgame.name: Guns and Gunners
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Expanded rules for firearm combat and 12 new gunslinging subclasses.

boardgame.name: How to Play DnD: A Quick Guide for New Players
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A concise presentation of the basic rules of the game, intended for use by newer players.

boardgame.name: Owlbear Den's Homebrew Digest
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This collection of material seeks to provide a number of options for players to utilize in their games, allowing for characters that otherwise wouldn't be possible without making sacrifices to viability.

boardgame.name: Variant Feat System
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

We all love feats. But not all feats are created equal. Sometimes it seems that some of the more niche feats are often pushed to the sidelines in favor of more powerful options. We see a lot of Sharpshooters, Sentinels, and Great Weapon Masters, but not a lot of Actors or Keen Mind users, which is a shame, because they are often really flavorful options that get sidelined in favor of keeping PCs alive. This variant system tries to mitigate this problem. It changes the more potent feats, separates them into different tiers, and gives a lot of options for players to build their characters in a way that is unique to them.

boardgame.name: Van Richten's Encyclopedia of Darklords & Domains Volume 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An encyclopedia of Ravenloft lore shared between two volumes! Explore every domain and struggle against new creatures that crawl the mists. Within, you will find stats for every Darklord, new items, spells, and everything you will ever need to run a Ravenloft Campaign in any of the domains.

Here in Volume 1 of Van Richten’s Encyclopedia, explore the Domains of the Northern and Southern Cores, sail the Domains of the Eastern and Western Seas, and venture to the Wandering Domains. Face evils beyond your darkest reckoning from The Devil Strahd to the brutish walking cadaver of Lamordia, Adam. Explore every domain and struggle against new creatures that crawl the mists. Within, you will find stats for every Darklord, new items, spells, and everything you will ever need to run a Ravenloft Campaign.

boardgame.name: Van Richten's Encyclopedia of Darklords & Domains Volume 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An encyclopedia of Ravenloft lore shared between two volumes! Explore every domain and struggle against new creatures that crawl the mists. Within, you will find stats for every Darklord, new items, spells, and everything you will ever need to run a Ravenloft Campaign in any of the domains.

Here in Volume 2 of Van Richten’s Encyclopedia, explore the Clusters of Ravenloft, visit the Isles of Terror that aimlessly float in the mists, and get lost in Gothic Earth where all the mythologies and spook stories are real. Face the Nightmare Court that infiltrates your dreams and try to veil your existence from Vecna, the master of secrets himself.

boardgame.name: La feria de Tristán
boardgame.description:
La feria de Tristán ("The Tristan Fair") is a competitive card game, where you will represent a fair walker trying to find everything you need for your shopping list (objectives). You will buy product cards, which will give you benefits and victory points at the end of the game.
On a day of the Tristan Fair sudden events can happen that will modify the course of the game a little. Prices will change as the game progresses, becoming cheaper to buy at certain stalls, but keep in mind that other players will also compete for better prices.
So try to go to the shopping stalls first, managing your money very well so as not to run out of it.

The goal of the game is to make the most points at the end of the game.
Each player will try to get product cards and will have to combine them with others, which will give them victory points, in different ways, at the end of the game.

boardgame.name: Scaffold
boardgame.description:
Introduction

Scaffold is a drawless connection game played on the intersections of a square grid using stones (as in Go). Black is trying to connect N-S edges of the board, White E-W with an orthogonally connected group.



Definitions

Group: Either a single stone (a group of one) or any number of stones of the same color connected through a continuous series of orthogonal adjacencies.



Play

First player places a single black stone on any grid intersection, after which the second player decides which color they will play (pie rule). Players then alternate taking turns.

On your turn, place a stone of your color on an empty point. Then, if possible, place a stone of your color on an empty point that is orthogonally adjacent to two groups of your color, and keep making such placements until no more are possible.



Acknowledgments

Every one of the regular posters on the BGG Abstract Game forum could rightfully consider themselves a co-author of this game if they wished. I'm like a kid who built something (hopefully cool!) out of LEGO -- but they made the bricks. Thank you all for your generosity and brilliance.

Luis Bolaños Mures helped clarify the presentation of the rules - Thanks.

This game shares some similarities with Quadrex by Bill Taylor, although it was arrived at independently.



Online Play

Scaffold is one of the many games that can be played for free at mindsports.nl. You can find it in the ArenA here:

https://mindsports.nl/index.php/arena/scaffold/

I'd like to express my gratitude to Christian Freeling and Ed van Zon for making this possible.

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Thrones & Bones Adventure Book: Sagas of Norrøngard
boardgame.description:
Back cover text:
"Thrones & Bones Adventure Book: Sagas of Norrøngard features seven adventures designed for character levels 3 through 8. Written by Lou Anders, Jeff Lee, Sarah Madsen, Ben McFarland, and Brian Suskind, this second hardcover volume is an essential companion to Thrones & Bones: Norrøngard, providing you with stories to run a 1st to 8th level campaign in the frozen north.

Also included are the rules for playing the popular sport of knattleikr, visiting the mysterious place of power known as Raven's Perch, and the Norrønian tale, "Kori and the Hungry Troll."

boardgame.name: Pizza Dominoes
boardgame.description:
Includes: 56 triangular dominoes, full instructions!
Match the toppings!

To win the game, you must be the first one,to get rid of your domino pieces, with matching the same toppings side.

Are you out with same toppings and can't put? Then pull a new one!

boardgame.name: Four Score
boardgame.description:
Four Score injects a modern and strategic twist into a classic gaming mechanism. Players compete with wooden sticks to complete a line of four on both sides of the game board. Diagonal, horizontal or vertical will do the trick. To be victorious in Four Score you will need a steady hand, a keen eye and a plan two steps ahead of your opponent.

Players take turns inserting wooden sticks through both sides of the game board, selecting which holes on either side as they play. Sticks can only be controlled from a players own side, not manipulated from within the game board.

The player who completes a line of four on both sides of the game board first is crowned the winner!

As games progress dexterity plays an increasing role. Dislodge a stick while attempting your move and your turn is over.

boardgame.name: CIFRA Code25
boardgame.description:
CIFRA is 2-players pure abstract strategy game on 5x5 flexible board.

Players take their turn alternately. During their play the player can move their own piece according to the moving rules. If a player moves their piece onto the tile which an opponent piece occupies, they can capture it like a Chess piece. If player moves their piece onto the opposite side, the piece is a goal and fixed there. Both players can't move it nor capture it.

When all alive five pieces of any one of players are captured or goal, then game is over.

boardgame.name: An Altogether Different River
boardgame.description:
From https://ehronlime.itch.io/an-altogether-different-river:

This is a GM-less roleplaying game meant for 2 to 4 players and a single session of about 3-4 hours. It is inspired in parts by Downfall, by Caroline Hobbs and Microscope, by Ben Robbins. You will need pencils and paper and maybe a deck of cards to pick randomly from lists.

It is about a Town, the people who have left it and returned, and the people who stayed behind.

It is about returning home and grappling with what has and hasn't changed.

boardgame.name: Branching Streams
boardgame.description:
From https://ehronlime.itch.io/branching-streams:

Branching Streams is a supplement to An Altogether Different River which collects several Game Seeds for the game plus a couple of hacks

boardgame.name: Sabotør
boardgame.description:
A game about cooperation, bluffing and deception.

Sabotør ("Saboteur") is a game where good cooperation is the key to success! Together with your teammates, you must cross the Atlantic Ocean in a galleon, but there are secret saboteurs who have only one goal in mind: Make sure the ship never reaches its destination, without being revealed.

This is a game where it can be fatal to trust other players. A game where your best friends will never hesitate to throw you into the sea and where you still depend on working together to reach the goal.

One person is Captain, changing each turn, and everyone gets 2 action cards they can play any time. Each round good and bad cards are passed around, everyone removing 1 card secretly and the Captain reveals the 3 remaining cards. He rolls a dice and the ship only moves forward if the roll is higher than red cards. Provision is automatically depleted by 1 each round. Everyone can get more action cards, shooting eachother, making someone walk the plank, get fish for extra food and so on. Hopefully the ship reach the destination, so the Saboteurs doesn't win!

boardgame.name: Manyfold Paths
boardgame.description:
ew Com Guard commands claim a more storied history than the Manyfold Paths. History remembers them fighting the Jade Falcons to great effect on Tukayyid and elsewhere. They also took the fight to the Word of Blake in the Chaos March. Later, they fought in the Great Refusal before the formation met its final end on Terra during Case White. Today the Manyfold Paths legacy continues in both spirit and will in the White Lions mercenary company, commanded by Seth Nicholson, a direct descendant of one of Manyfold Paths’ commanders. The White Lions made a name for themselves fighting Malvina Hazen’s Jade Falcons.

Spotlight On: Manyfold Paths includes a Unit History, Personalities, Personnel Rosters, Mission Tracks, and data for use with all scales of BattleTech play.

- from publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Hellion Keshik
boardgame.description:
Death From Above. No words better describe Hellion Keshik, the bodyguard Trinary for Clan Goliath Scorpion’s saKhan. Few formations conjure terror amongst their enemies more than this assemblage of warriors. Forged from tattered remnants of two Clans, one absorbed and the other abjured, Hellion Keshik welded their disparate philosophies into one. As the tip of the spear for Hellion Galaxy, the Keshik does more than protect the saKhan. These warriors train endlessly and fight savagely like no others in the Scorpion Touman. The Keshik has never tasted defeat, because victory is so sweet.

Spotlight On: Hellion Keshik includes a Unit History, Personalities, Personnel Rosters, Mission Tracks, and data for use with all scales of BattleTech play.

- from publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Die Rad-Wettfahrt
boardgame.description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the player. The first player to reach space 57 wins the game.

The game was probably published in the 1920's.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Knockdown: Chilly – Business Pingwin
boardgame.description: What will the Penguin show us today? He showed himself in the Arena, trying to knock down his enemies! Will you make the Globetrotter from Etherfields a winner in a Great Tournament?

boardgame.name: Knockdown: Cleito – Queen of Atlantis
boardgame.description: The Queen of Atlantis does her best to rule over the Arena. Use the powers of the glorious Cleito from Lords of Hellas to knock down your enemies and become a winner in the Great Tournament!

boardgame.name: Rocky
boardgame.description:
Once a cool, but beautiful world, rich in natural resources, Rocky led a charmed existence as one of the first planets colonized by humankind. As a paradise settled by some of Terra’s wealthiest citizens, its people wanted for little, and strife was rare for centuries. But like the Hegemony it belonged to, Rocky fell to the darkness of the Amaris years, and saw its killing blows come in the form of a rare battle between Houses Steiner and Davion at the dawn of the Succession Wars. Now little more than another ruined casualty of human avarice, Rocky is little remembered by the Inner Sphere at large—save for the rumors of stolen treasures of the Star League, lost beneath its frozen wastes.

Touring the Stars is a whistle-stop tour of the universe! Every system and planet where mankind treads in the BattleTech universe has a story, for those with the drive to explore it. Take a tour of the stars humanity now calls home, experience awesome new worlds, immerse yourself in the local civilization, and prepare to do battle in exotic locales.

- from the publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Kerensky's Vision
boardgame.description:
Once known as Qualip, during the first Star League the unfortunate world became a cautionary tale of botched terraforming and human ignorance as entire continents became locked in ecological warfare even before Combine nukes fell in the Succession Wars. When the Clans invaded, ilKhan Ulric Kerensky saw in abandoned Qualip a chance to implement Nicholas Kerensky’s vision for the Inner Sphere and the Clans, and the rechristened Kerensky’s Vision became that chance. Setting Clan science to restore a paradise world lost to war created a planet unique in the occupation zone. On Kerensky’s Vision, Clan and Inner Sphere merchants compete, while others smuggle, spy, and even steal in the packed enclaves of the capital. Here, anything can be bought—for a price.

- from the publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Kandersteg
boardgame.description:
Once a sleepy Lyran backwater noted primarily for its interesting local dialect and minor industrial exports, Kandersteg found itself much closer to the front lines during the first Clan Invasion of the 3050s. Now, a century later, Kandersteg is thrust into the spotlight in the wake of the Clans’ move to conquer Terra, where it finds itself in the center of a budding Tamar liberation movement and home to a fast-growing Hiring Hall as mercenaries from around the Inner Sphere prepare to take the fight to the enemy.

- from the publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Granada
boardgame.description:
Granada: called “The Pumpkin” by everyone but its inhabitants, this oblate planet is probably the fastest-spinning world settled by humanity. Like other worlds of the Nueva Castilian cluster, it is water-rich and very compatible with terrestrial life, allowing humans to thrive.

Granada has seen key events in Castilian history: the collapse of its original central government, the invasion of refugees from the Clan worlds, and the birth of the Umayyads. The Seekers of Clan Goliath Scorpion have delved into this history, answering burning questions of the Umayyads’ mysterious origins.

- from the publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Legends
boardgame.description:
Across the centuries, the fate of the Inner Sphere changed time and again with the actions of one MechWarrior and one 'Mech fighting at the crux of history. There stories became legends passed down through the years, and now these legends and their 'Mechs stand revealed as never before.

BattleTech: Legends depicts fifty-two of the universe's most famous--and infamous--MechWarrors and their 'Mechs from every era of BattleTech including the upcoming ilClan era. Each entry includes gorgeous full-color portraits of the character and game specs for their machines, and delves into their battle history as a MechWarrior to reveal all-new details never before published. Finally, each era section kicks off with all-new fiction by some of BattleTech's own Legendary authors!

- from publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Schmidt's Petraries
boardgame.description:
Captain-Marshal Rudolf Schmidt took command of the Hanseatic Defense Force at a critical juncture. The nearby Scorpion Empire posed an existential threat to the Hanseatic League. While reorganizing the HDF, he recognized a crucial need for an elite company to inspire the troops. Thus was born Schmidt’s Petraries, the HDF’s overall command company and home to the best of the best. Intense training with their comrades was far different from the trial by fire that the Petraries faced when the Scorpion Empire finally invaded. The Petraries rose to the occasion, defying the fearsome invaders and inspiring a nation with their deeds.

Spotlight On: Schmidt’s Petraries includes a Unit History, Personalities, Personnel Rosters, Mission Tracks, and data for use with all scales of BattleTech play.

- from the publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Artisans
boardgame.description:
Through the centuries Artisans have been skilled workers, specialized craftsmen in creating art, functional or decorative objects. Sculptures, drawings, jewelry, clothes, constructions of different shapes and sizes. The work of Artisans has shaped the history of art and some creations have reached such worldwide fame; they influence even the modern world.

Artisans is a fast and exciting but challenging family card game for 2 to 4 players which lasts 30 to 45 minutes. Players are trying to develop their skills in the use of seven different materials: clay, metal, wood, stone, gold, glass and textiles in such a way so that their level of expertise in these materials grants them the necessary skills to craft beautiful Art objects.

Each player chooses initially one from the nine available Artisan profiles. Each Artisan has a unique ability which helps and defines the strategy of the players. Additionally, each player takes randomly 6 material cards. Finally, 4 Art objects are drawn randomly and become available for crafting. All the material cards are depicting the level of skill (I -> IV) in each of their corners and all the Art objects are depicting the materials and the required level of skill which the players need to have so they can craft them.

A game is played in 12 rounds (the months of a year), where players are trying to craft Art objects and win victory points. Each round has 2 phases.

During the first phase, players are either sequentially trading or collecting material cards from a central market or craft one of the available Art objects. The first phase ends when one player signifies the closing of the market by claiming the first player token. Then all other players have one last chance to visit the market.

In the second phase, players are developing their skills by playing any number of cards of one material type of their choice. Every additional time they play the same material they upgrade their skill to the next level. However, they cannot play more cards than those that they have played on the previous level. Through this smart mechanism the number of cards played in each level matters, because at the end of the game every single material card scores points equal to the said level.
In the end of the 12 rounds players are counting the points from the crafted Art objects plus the points for the material cards and any additional points that their Artisan’s profile may score. The player with the most points is declared the winner!

Use the material market to your benefit, claim the first player token in the right time to close the market and smartly manage your material cards in an effective way! The numerous combinations, the great replay ability, the strategic decisions and the challenging competition will leave anyone satisfied! Embrace the role of an Artisan and let the beautiful artwork take you on a journey through art and history!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Ticket to Europe
boardgame.description:
Ticket to Europe is a socially engaged, cooperative role-playing board game for 1-4 people. The player assumes the role of a refugee traveling from Africa to Europe. The game portrays the reality of the smuggling world and confronts players with morally difficult choices.
As part of the documentation, the creators visited a refugee camp on the Greek island of Lesbos, in order to present the phenomenon of the migration crisis as accurately as possible.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Santiago Campaign 1898
boardgame.description:
Santiago Campaign 1898 is a two-player simulation of the campaign for Santiago de Cuba, which historically ended in the surrender of all Spanish forces on the island.

Units are battalions and regiments. Each hex is 1.6 km across. Turns represent one day each. To win, the US player must conquer most objectives and force the sortie of the Spanish fleet before the Yellow Fever season sets in.

Paper Wars Magazine #102, Fall 2022

boardgame.name: Fear Factory V (Cepheus)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fear Comes For YOU!

Fear Factory V is in full production...can you overcome your terror? A simple contract investigating disappearances on the moon of Telsix will expose you to a darker side of the colony's secret past. Telsix ever progresses forward as a leader in AI research, but a blend of technology and madness haunts every scientific advance. On the outskirts of the colony sits a former scientific research facility, but it is now little more than a condemned junkyard. This landfill is the site of recent disappearances and disturbances, and now outsiders must discover the truth behind these events .. and what they will find is grim and grisly...

Fear Factory V is a standalone Cepheus Engine compatible adventure. Feel free to use Fear Factory V in conjunction with any other Cepheus campaign. This adventure should last 4-8 hours based on play style.
This adventure contains ...

8 new adversaries, from cyborgs to something much, much, worse.
Multiple traps and environmental obstacles.
Many terrible horrors to cause panic and stress.
Multiple approaches to complete the adventure.
A reflective ending that asks, "What is life?"

boardgame.name: Dire Quagmire
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Six teens are lost in the Louisiana Bayou. In a locale full of dangerous animals, the real threat is the humans and what they will do to cover up their secrets. Will the Secret Agents of CROSS be able to rescue the teens in time?

boardgame.name: Sneed's Travel Guide to Cacophony
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the Port City of Cacophony, home to adventure and heroes! This comphrensive guide introduces players of all levels to a big city and is a precursor to the release of our new campaign!

boardgame.name: Heart of War
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Following the trail of the ancient trekth leads the adventurers to another planet, one already ravaged by the progenitors—Seretse. Once there however, leaving proves to be a difficult task and there is great need for the intervention of powerful outsiders. Elemental armies besiege the asteroid fortress of the prevailing warlord Garajax the Vicious and within his alien chest beats the key to the conflict barring the party's way to learning more about what threatens their world.

What's inside Heart of War:

An adventure on a different world for PCs of 22nd level.
Statistics for elite alien shock troops, the alien warlord, and armies of elementals (earth and fire).
The Heart of Primordial Flame, a potent artifact that offers whoever takes it great power—but not without cost.
More details about the mysterious Trekth and the effects of their world runes.
Pregenerated adventurers of 22nd level for every class.

boardgame.name: Neues Luftballon-Spiel "Die lenkbaren"
Neues Luftballonspiel
boardgame.description:
The goal of the game is to rise 7000 m into the air and then land your balloon safely. Movement is determined by 3 dice. Two numbered dice determine the rise and descent of a balloon, whereas the letter die determines movement to the left or right.
On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. If a balloon rises above 6300 m it risks its passengers freezing to death or the balloon blowing up.

The first player to safely land his balloon wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Turning Points: Helm
boardgame.description:
The Gray Death Legion: Mercenaries betrayed by their employer and betrayed from within. Mariks and ComStar oppose them. Can Grayson Carlyle lead his command out of the trap that has ensnared them? Only quick, decisive action and determination will see them survive overwhelming odds.

Helm: A world of glaciers, tundra, rock-filled deserts, barren seas, and an ancient Star League secret. That secret could destroy the Legion and move humanity another step closer toward darkness. Or one step closer toward salvation. Helm and humanity’s future lay in the grasp of an outlawed mercenary unit.

Turning Points: Helm uses Chaos Campaign rules to give players the option of fighting individual battles or to follow a campaign arc. Included are a detailed map of the world of Helm, a run down of the forces involved, and scenario tracks recreating the battles on Helm.

- blurb from the publisher
boardgame.rpg: A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: BattleTech: ilClan
boardgame.description:
Fortune Favors the Bold…

In 2825, ilKhan Nicholas Kerensky, the founder of the Clans, gave his exiled, warrior-led people a dream: the first Clan to return to the Inner Sphere and claim Terra, the cradle of humanity, in honorable combat would claim the title of ilClan—ruler of all the Clans. The ilClan would reestablish the venerable Star League from the ashes of the old, and its Khan would become ilKhan, supreme ruler of all the Clans. Now, 326 years later, the Children of Kerensky have fought their way to Terra with the intent of fulfilling this dream. But will this dream become destiny or nightmare?

Delve into what it means to be the ilClan, and experience the tumultuous Battle of Terra, which will shake the very foundations of the Inner Sphere. Then catch a glimpse of how the Great Houses and other major powers will face the outcome of this far-reaching conflict. Tactical maps, Chaos Campaign tracks, and new ’Mechs that debuted during the Battle of Terra all let you jump right into the cockpit and fight in the culmination of over three centuries of Clan history. Do you have what it takes to conquer the birthplace of humankind, or the courage to defend Terra from its enemies?

- from the publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Dance:UK 8 Step Dancemat
boardgame.description:
User Summary

An 85 x 95 cm mat which is connectable to any PS(1) and PS2 console which "houses" 8-way action buttons for playing Dance:UK or any [videogameplatform=4433] and [videogameplatform=4434] dancing game.

It was sold separately or as a bundled package with Dance:UK for one platform.


Box back
8 Step Dancemat
For use with all Playstation games consoles PlayStation, PSone + PlayStation 2

DANCE:UK is the new ot, sassy, dancing and singing game for all PlayStation consoles. This unique game combines awesome 8-step DANCE moves and KARAOKE, with up-to-date MASSIVE TUNES, giving endless hours of fun for you and your friends, creating an instant party!

So be a star - getdown and Party!

8 Step Dancemat features

Designed to be fully compatible with "Dance:UK" dance game
Pressure Sensitive Action buttons
Start + select buttons
Volume control pads
On/Off karaoke functions
L & R function buttons
Compatible with all PSone & PS2 Dance Games
Durable

boardgame.name: Wrath & Glory Gamemaster's Screen
boardgame.description:
The Wrath and Glory Gamemaster’s Screen is an indispensable addition to every GM’s toolkit! The GM screen contains a wealth of information, commonly referenced rules, and an additional 32 page booklet packed with advice, NPCs, and short adventures suitable for any group.

The Gamemaster’s Screen: A three-panel GM screen with stunning artwork depicting an epic struggle between the Adepta Sororitas and Necrons of an unknown dynasty.
The interior screen contains at-a-glance references for the most used rules, perfect to keep gameplay flowing.

The Gamemaster’s Guide: A 32-page booklet packed with advice, NPCs and Adventures.

Six new, highly detailed NPCs with plot hooks and agendas, spread throughout the Gilead system, perfect for use as trusted allies or staunch foes.

Eight new adventures, two each for Tiers 1 through 4, designed to draw players into the intrigue and adventure of Wrath and Glory.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Discipline ～ジェレミア魔法学校の3年間～
boardgame.description:
Discipline is a cooperative game where players take on the role of new instructors at the prestigious Jeremiah School of Magic. Over the course of three years, they work to balance each student's needs, provide encouragement, and help them graduate. Should one instructor ever find themselves a bit overwhelmed, they can call on their co-workers for a helping hand.

After choosing from one of the four classes, players receive the corresponding event chart, seat number deck, and student cards. The students are shuffled and randomly placed in a 3x4 grid, which forms the seating chart for the room. Then seat number cards are drawn to determine the initial placement of power and negative markers.

Play proceeds through a series of lesson rounds, both group and individual ones. Instructors try to balance encouragement and enthusiasm via the movement of power markers while slowing or outright eliminating the stress and frustration from the negative markers. Should a student ever accumulate enough stress, they can spread it to others around them or even become absent.

At the close of three years, students are subject to a final exam. After that, those that are absent or lack at least one power marker fail to graduate. Teachers are then provided with a title and evaluation based on their work. If too many students fail to pass, all the instructors are also seen as failures and lose.

boardgame.name: Kangchenjunga
boardgame.description:
Kangchenjunga is a game for two to five players aged 7+ which takes 15 to 20 minutes to play. Based on the epic 1930 Himalayan adventure which ultimately failed to climb the third highest peak in the world, the game uses original photos and draws on Frank Smythe's book The Kangchenjunga Adventure, written almost 100 years ago.

In the first part of the game the players recruit climbers and sherpas, and gather a range of other resources. These are all represented on the cards. This calls for a mixture of set-building and push-your-luck, as you aim to bring together the strongest expedition possible. Although the game is competitive, there are ways of helping each other too.

The second part of the game sees the players making their final preparations for an assault on the summit of Kangchenjunga. Some cards may not be useable if the set isn't correct. Then the summit attempt begins and players take it in turns to advance up the mountain. Kangchenjunga is 28,156 feet tall, and successful players must achieve this. But whatever the outcome, details of the players' expeditions can be recorded in the 'Hall of Fame' at the back of the Almanac.

Kangchenjunga works beautifully as a 'filler' game for a wide range of ages. Simple to learn, the game-play has surprising depths and re-playability is high. See the Rulebook and Almanac link below for full details of how the game plays.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Aquamarine
boardgame.description:
Dive deep down into the ocean and discover a vibrant underwater world in this exciting single-sheet print at home game.

Manage your oxygen reserves as you plunge beneath the ocean surface. Will you seek out fish and coral in the narrow sea caves? Or race to be first to reach the ocean floor?

On a turn 2 dice are rolled for all players. Using one of the dice results, players will mark their game sheets to show the position of their diver. The lower value dice might limit your options, but if you pick the higher value, you must use an amount of O2 equal to the difference. Choosing when to strike out is vital for seeing the most on your limited time beneath the waves!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Ya-La-Vi
boardgame.description:
Ideal for family play and easy to play alone between childhoods. Between 2 cards… Which image is repeated??? mmmm… I ALREADY SAW IT!

You have to say it quickly, as soon as you found the match. The more attention you have, the easier you will see them! Hurry up, concentrate, wake up because in this game, speed rushes us and fun awaits us. If you take two cards and look closely, you will see that they always have one image in common (one and only one). So the goal of the game (in its 5 variants) is to find that common image between two cards and name them as quickly as possible.

1- Pile, Pile with challenges!
A card with images is distributed to each participant and the rest are placed in a pile in the center, with the images visible. You must look for the common image between the card that touched you and the first of the stack. Whoever names the match first draws the center card and places it on top of their own pile. when a challenge card appears, whoever meets it first wins the indicated cards. The game ends when there are no more cards in the center of the table and whoever collects the most cards wins.

2- Discard with challenges!
Opposite of "Stack, stack": a card is placed in the center of the table and the rest are distributed among those who play. Each participant has to find the common image between the card that is on the table and the first of their stack. When the match is found, it quickly drops it on the table, discarding itself. Whoever runs out of cards first wins. In this variant they also play the 4 challenge cards, each time a participant reveals one of these cards, they must read it aloud to the rest... So everyone participates!

3- The jersey (without challenges)
In the center of the table 9 cards are placed face up. The jersey is assembled by finding the same image on three different cards. Whoever forms them first and names the image that matches, takes all three cards (which must be replaced so that there are always 9 cards on the table). Once the cards are finished, whoever collected the most wins.

4- Take it yourself! (no challenges)
Each participant receives a card face down. The remaining cards are placed in a stack face up in the center of the table. Each participant has to find the common image between the card of the center and that of any participant (except their own). When the match is found, give the center card to whoever has the card with the match. Whoever keeps the most cards loses.

5- Pass it fast! (no challenges)
Each participant puts a card on the palm of his hand, in view of the rest. When someone finds the image in common between one card and another, he puts his own card on the matching card. Here nobody wins, but whoever keeps all the cards at the end loses.

boardgame.name: Tellatale
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tellatale is a world created during an event called the Grand Conjunction. This event fused together a number of disparate fairy tale worlds causing havoc for the transported beings, and creating strife between the new neighbors.

The campaign setting details a continent made up of zones based on the works of the Brothers Grimm, Baum, Barrie, classic Chinese and Japanese mythologies, and more!

Never Neverland: Ruled by the amoral creature known as the Pan, Neverland is the domain of the Lost Children: adolescents stolen from across the cosmos. It is also populated with pixies, pirates, and a tribe of technologically advanced humans.
The Land of Oz: Oz is known for the creation of living constructs. It is divided in to four sections, each controlled by a High Witch. Together with the fabled Wizard of Oz, the High Witches make up the Council of Oz which rules the Zone.
Wonderland: A chaotic dictatorship ruled by the Red Queens, Wonderland's geography can change in a heartbeat. It is said Wonderland connects to all worlds, so a visitor can find great adventure there, as long as they don't lose their head.
The Black Forest: Before the Conjunction, the Black Forest was an alliance of four kingdoms bonded in peace. The chaos of joining with Tellatale spelled disaster for the kingdoms, plunging the Zone largely into anarchy. It is a land of rugged adventure, giants, dwarves, and witches.
Shinozon: Ruled by the Jade Emperor and his nobles, Shinozon's archipelago is an ancient empire mired in political intrigue and assassinations. The mainland of the Zone is a dangerous realm filled with oni and shapechangers.
The Grand Library: Not part of the continent, it is debatable if the Grand Library counts as a Zone. This shrouded island is home to a group with the ridiculous belief that all the inhabitants of Tellatale are works of fiction brought to life. While they are mocked for this belief, no one can deny their powers; which can re-write someone's being or destiny.


Travel between the zones, or you can treat it as five full campaign settings!

To immerse your characters into this new world the campaign book contains:

Two full classes; complete with variants
Variants for each base class including 19 new cleric domains as each Zone has a complete cosmology!
A whopping 29 new player races including tiny and large races (with special rules for running them), shapeshifters and even flying races!
Backgrounds and new items to make your characters at home in this new world.

boardgame.name: Operation Praying Mantis, April 18 1988
boardgame.description:
“Time is now against Iran.” –Chairman and de facto commander-in-chief, Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani’s comment following Operation Praying Mantis.

Following the destruction of Iran Air Flight 655 by the US, fully loaded with pilgrims on their way to Mecca for the Haj, the Iranian military vowed revenge against the “Great Satan”. With Grand Ayatollah Khomeni gravely ill, there was no one in charge within the Iranian government or military who could or would thwart this dangerous escalation of force. On April 14 the FFG (guided missile frigate) USS Samuel Roberts struck a mine at the edge of the international maritime channel near the Gulf of Bahrain while escorting a fleet of oil tankers. While no one aboard the stricken vessel was killed or seriously injured, the mine blew a gaping twenty-foot wide hole in the ship. Only the quick and skilled action by its crew kept USS Samuel Roberts from sinking. It was quickly determined by investigators that the Iranians had deployed the mines, and National Security Advisor, General Colin Powell advised President Reagan that a massive demonstration of force was required to demonstrate once and for all that Iranian armed interference with the flow of ship traffic in the Persian Gulf would not be tolerated.

Operation Praying Mantis was the largest US fleet action since the Second World War. While the US had a preponderance of force, any error or serious loss could possibly embolden the Iranians, especially the hard liners who resisted any end to the war with Iraq or compromise with the US-led coalition that opposed them. Operation Praying Mantis is a solitaire play game with the active player taking on the role of the commander of the US naval force charged with implementing the operation. The game’s rules govern the Iranian response. Can you do as well or better?

Each copy of Operation Praying Mantis is composed of the following:

One 11 by 17 inch map
112 single-sided, unmounted counters
One player's aid sheet
6 pages of rules

Players will also need a six-sided die and one standard deck of playing cards to play the game. A custom card set that replaces the standard deck of playing cards, has rules reminders on pertinent cards, and features graphics by Bruce Yearian is available from High Flying Dice Games.

—description from the designer

Paypal gladly accepted. Check or money order only from domestic USA customer.

boardgame.name: SingStar Microphones
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A set of two wired microphones (one with a blue ring and one with a pink ring) and a USB converter to be used in PS2 or PS3. It can also be used on PS4, but since the console was not launched at the time it was not branded as an item for this console.

Unofficially can be used in Windows 10 computers but only using the blue port in the USB Converter.

The microphones exist both in a separate box and bundled boxes where a game is included.
Other manufactures have also made variants including Playmax

boardgame.name: Gröönkohl
boardgame.description:
A German exclusive, promotional adventure for Cthulhu 7th Edition given out at Gratisrollenspieltag 2022 (German Free RPG Day)

Backcover text (translated with google translate)
In the 1920s, the investigators take part in an uplifting cabbage trip „Kohlfahrt“ in East Friesland, Northern Germany, and can look forward to socializing with happy fellow participants. What could possibly go wrong? Why do the people at the next table behave so... strangely in the country inn that is the destination of the Kohlfahrt?

boardgame.name: Conquest
boardgame.description:
“Conquest” dates back to the 19th century and is one of the many games inspired by Checkers and Chess and which are also inspired by real historical episodes, such as battles, sieges, military events; among these games we remember “Asalto”, “Assault” and “Siege of Paris”. The game is developed on a 9x9 chessboard; each player has eight Soldiers and a King, initially arranged in the 3x3 lower right and upper left areas; the King is placed in the center of these areas and is completely surrounded by the eight Soldiers. The goal of the game is to conquer the Fortress, which is the 3x3 area in the center of the game board.
Information on this game is not readily available: it is mentioned in “Il Grande Manuale dei Giochi da Tavolo” by Giuseppe Meroni and Aldo Spinelli (1996).

boardgame.name: Catan: Treasures, Dragons & Adventurers – Wooden Pieces
boardgame.description:
These big pieces have been created to match the wooden version of Catan (not the Viking wooden pieces).
The set contains of 16 cities, 4 per player color, 19 dragons and 19 flag stickers.

boardgame.name: Irish Freedom
boardgame.description:
Irish Freedom is a solitaire wargame that simulates the Irish War of Independence from 1919 to 1921 and also covers the Irish Civil War from 1922 to 1923.

As the player, you play the Irish rebel forces fighting for Independence against the British in the War of Independence. If you are successful in this, you then play the Free State forces against the Republican enemy in the Irish Civil War. Alternatively, you may play either war as a stand-alone game.

Game play involves moving your forces, represented by counters, on a map of Ireland. You can also raise fresh forces to help your armed operations. A simulated enemy move will attempt to prevent your victory. Victory is achieved by a combination of how quickly you can win the War of Independence and how quickly/completely you can win the Civil War.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: As the Gods Demand
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

As the Gods Demand is a deconstruction of divine power and deities for use in the world’s most popular role-playing game.

Rather than treat gods and their power as something a player can earn through leveling up, As the Gods Demand present divine power as something that can be wielded and earned by anyone, provided they take the appropriate steps and sacrifices. Walking the path of a cleric or zealot now requires action and risks consequence, allowing players to make interesting choices if they wish to seek greater power. The many gods within the zine offer all manner of powers and boons if the faithful is willing to undertake tasks to earn their favor.

What's Inside

- Miracles of the Gods: Player rules for a level-less divine magic system involving Favor, Miracles, and Rites
- A Curious Pantheon: A series of 8 gods for both GM and player to explore; each with their own miracles, rituals, and demands.
- Death is Not the End: Accessory rules on player death and converting your lost companions into relics to assist in death.
- Heavenly Servants: Divine-inspired encounters and monsters.
- Steps to becoming a deity yourself...

The content in this zine was designed to be mostly system-neutral. While much of it operates with a twenty-sided dice in mind, they can be easily adapted to fit most systems.

boardgame.name: Killsquad
boardgame.description:
HIGH INTENSITY GAMEPLAY Killsquad deliveres frantic, direct, skill-oriented control on keyboard or gamepad. Shoot fast, dodge fast, or die even faster. Our core are short, 10-20 minute adrenaline pumping contracts you can enjoy solo or with up to 4 friends in co-op. So it feels a bit like a twin stick shooter. Or a hack and slash. Or a top-down dungeon crawler. Or a sci-fi bullet hell. Well, it feels like Killsquad. And it’s a lot of fun to play, solo or with others.

DEEP SKILL CUSTOMIZATION Killsquad features four hero classes for you to choose from, each with their own weapons and skills. These combine melee and ranged characters to fit different playstyles. Along your adventures, you’ll be able to acquire and equip powerful upgrades for each of your skills, which activate during your contracts. And, if you survive, claim your bounty to spend it on tons of new equipment, such as weapons, power-ups and gear, or cosmetics to show off.

A RICH UNIVERSE Fight your way through +30 contracts in the Campaign Map, visiting five planets along the way. Jump in with your friends or with any other bounty hunter. You can come to the aid of another squad by joining them mid-mission in real time. Cooperate to complete each contract or compete between each other to earn the highest scores.

LOOT, LOOT AND MORE LOOT Obtain weapons and gears with unique characteristics that affect the skills of your hero. Earn the trust of the Unseen by finding their Talismans: strong and complex artifacts with exciting passive effects. But be wary, these abilities at first will be detrimental, but through effort and killing lots of monsters can level up to turn into powerful items. Use everything in combination with your skills and upgrades to create game-breaking builds, and make the heroes your own.

ENEMIES GALORE But this party would not be complete without the main course: the enemies. Hordes and waves of disturbing enemies will make their way to you, clawing and biting till there’s nothing left. But do not worry, you will be fine. It is the bosses which will make you tremble. More than 15 bosses will put you to the test, each with different sets of mechanics and unique ways to be beaten.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Glow Spotters
boardgame.description:
The Glow Spotters Troop is on a nature adventure, trying to count fireflies to earn their Firefly badges. Each player has a set of firefly boards numbered 1 to 10. Players roll the die and collect various shaped Glow Tiles to reach the sum of fireflies on their boards. The first player to complete all their boards wins the game and receives their Firefly badge.

Skills Focus : Addition, Spatial Reasoning

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Casting Shadows: The Ice Storm Expansion
boardgame.description:
The 5-6 player expansion pack adds 2 new characters, 3 new locations, new spells/counterspells/companions, and some new mechanics into the game (in particular, freeze and stun status effects, which is why it comes with status effect tokens). It does let you expand the game for up to 6 people, but the 2 new characters and hex tiles can still be used even instead of characters and hex tiles from the base game even if you're playing with fewer people.

The Freeze status effect prevents an enemy from using the Travel action on their next turn

The Stun status effect reduces the number of resource dice an enemy gets to roll on their next turn.

boardgame.name: Casting Shadows: Lucky Skipper / Lucky the Unstable Player Board
boardgame.description:
Kickstarter Exclusive "Lucky Skipper" / "Lucky the Unstable" Character Player Board and meeples. This was free to backers of previous campaigns and available as an add-on.

Lucky Skipper
"Spend 3 Shadow Energy to transform into Shadow Form."
/Lucky the Unstable
"Spend 2 Shadow Energy to move your Character from your current Hex tile to any Hex tile on the Map OR Spend 4 Shadow Energy to add the top card from the Main deck to your Spell Book."

boardgame.name: Solar Expansion
boardgame.description:
Stardate 1800, five years after the first permanent human settlement on Mars. Regular trade routes are established between the inner planets, and the spaceports grow into major cities. Helium-3 mined from the ice giants becomes our most valuable resource, as fusion reactors become the radiant heart of the asteroid-cities far from the warming rays of our sun. Meanwhile, a shadow economy is growing stronger. Space pirates patrol the inky void, employing new versions of classic tactics.

Solar Expansion is a space-themed 18xx game with simple navigation and complex corruption.

Three tiers of operating company (private minors, pirates, and full-cap public) provide creative embezzling opportunities and increase player interactivity. Pirates run protection rackets to benefit themselves (and occasionally the businesses they protect), while the minor companies are pocket-to-pocket cash delivery missiles.

This game borrows the East Asia Expansion engine, removes all the safeties, and takes off like a rocket!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Catcott Collection
boardgame.description:
A scholar working within the Catcott Collection in the Bristol Museum's archives has been plagued by headaches ever since their journey to the South West of England. When they find an untitled 13th Century text it begins a series of unusual events that sees them trapped in their rooms at The Royal Hotel, with seemingly no avenue for escape...

The Catcott Collection is a one-to-one Call of Cthulhu 7th Edition scenario for 1920s Bristol, UK.

It includes everything needed to run the game smoothly and with minimal prep:


Detailed guidance for running the adventure for the Keeper



A pre-made character for the Player



A map of Riley's rooms and vivid descriptions of the space



Optional handouts based on real photos of Bristol from the early 20th Century



Scenario hooks to fit the adventure into a wider campaign


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Uh Oh! at home
boardgame.description:
Uh Oh! What's going to happen?
Turn over the cards to discover cheeky surprises in this educational card game created for babies (yes, babies!), toddlers and up!

With 8 different ways to play, little ones can explore the concept of consequences, build puzzles, find objects, play memory games and more! Each card is illustrated by Parker Jacobs (designer behind the preschool hit Yo Gabba Gabba!) into 4 familiar rooms (kitchen, bedroom, bathroom and garden) giving you new ways to bond with your children.

Uh Oh! at home is the second game in a range of card games designed to grow with your family. The games and activities are suitable for different stages of development and can be played by children of different ages at the same time.

8 in 1 games and activities for 1 - 4 players aged 0 to 4+. (6 are co-operative, 2 competitive.) The colourful, A6 sized laminated cards are designed for little hands and made from FSC card in the UK. (Single use plastic free and Carbon Balanced with the World Land Trust.)

—description from designer

boardgame.name: Schmuggler und Grenzwächter
boardgame.description:
One player has 7 red pawns (smugglers), which start on the spaces marked with an "A" and has to to cross the border and escape by leaving the game board via one of the spaces marked with a "C". For every escaped smuggler the player is awarded points.

The other player has 4 green pawns (border patrol) on one side of the border and 3 blue pawns on the other side. He has to prevent the smugglers to reach their goal. Members of the border patrol are not allowed to cross the border, but they may occupy spaces on the border.

Movement is one space for one pawn per turn. If a pawn gets on a space with is connected to a space which is already occupied by an enemy pawn, ist is lost and eliminated from the game and the enemy takes it's place.

After a second game with reversed roles the player with the most points is the winner.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Affen-Theater
boardgame.description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. Sometimes the player has to take a detour. The first to reach space 50 wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Boeing 787 Dreamliner
Fly The Boeing 787 Dreamliner
boardgame.description:
Back of box (European)

Be one of the first to pilot Boeing's brand new airliner!

Boeing 787 Dreamliner gives you the opportunity to pilot one of the biggest and most exciting new passenger airliners in the world. With more than 400 of them on order from airlines around the world, the Boeing 787 looks to be a true "next generation" aircraft. Although not scheduled to enter service until 2008, Boeing's latest offering will carry 300 passengers up to 8000 miles at Mach .85. Its high-tech design will also make it the most fuel efficient jetliner in the world.

Designed with painstaking attention to detail the developers of this Microsoft Flight Simulator 2004/FSX compatible expansion pack had their top designer, the legendary Tolga Piskin, spend hour upon hour recreating the immersive feel of this aircraft's superb cockpit. The Boeing 787 Dreamliner benefits from a strikingly handsome outer body, but this package's real piece de resistence is the full 3D virtual cockpit. the specialised instrumentation includes a customized Flight Management Computer (FMC) which is virtually identical to the real thing along with the complete easy-to-follow documentation to learn how to use it. The FMC works with Flight Simulator's build in Flight Planner and allows you to fly virtually hands-off except for taking off and landing. This package also includes a series of flights for you to pilot which represent authentic passenger routes and schedules.

Included are these liveries:

Icelandair
All Nippon AIrways
Boeing House Colours
Sucuba
Lynx Airways VA
Air Florida VA
Pinellas VA
Air Tampa
LSA VA
West Wind AIrlines VA
Fly UK VA
Noble Air VA
Atlantic Skies VA
Boeing 787 Paint Kit with blank textures
boardgame.videogameexpansion: Microsoft Flight Simulator 2004: A Century of Flight

boardgame.name: Traffic X
boardgame.description:
Box back (European edition)

Eight years and five versions of Flight Simulator have flown by since Just Flight published the first instalment in its legendary Traffic series. Traffic X is the latest version to make the simulated skies 'as busy as it gets' and sets the bar for Artificial Intelligence traffic expansions.

Traffic X has been designed to Flight Simulator X SP2 and DX10 Preview standards from the ground up and takes full advantage of the powerful FSX software engine. There are so many new features in Traffic X that it's more of a revolution than an evolution.

(Includes over 1,700 different variants based on more than 80 aeroplane models designed to the highest level of AI aircraft detail - get the pilot's perspective in each one with the Flyable Aircraft Tool!)

(Airlines, GA, military and commuter types will fill your skies - check them out in the exclusive printed Spotter's Guide!)

(Incredible range of new features - ChronoTraffic provides traffic from different time periods, the Traffic Control Centre allows you to customise your traffic, and with the Traffic Radar in the control tower you can monitor the multitude of movements!)

(Drive the airport vehicles and monitor traffic from ground level!)

boardgame.name: Frostlands of Fenrilik
boardgame.description:
Adventure Awaits in the Frozen North

Frostlands of Fenrilik is an expansion for Scarred Lands 5e OGL that explores the frozen continent of Fenrilik. Known as the Roof of the World, Fenrilik is a massive frozen tundra filled with unique creatures, dangerous weather and deadly Titanspawn.

This book is created through the Slarecian Vault Community Content program and is designed to not only permit your party to take their adventures to Fenrilik, but also to allow you to create your own Fenrilik content for release via the Slarecian Vault!

Frostlands of Fenrilik includes:


Information on the history, geography, civilizations and religions of Fenrilik
New rules for travel and survival in the arctic wastes
New player options including 3 new races, 4 new subclasses, and 8 new spells
Over a dozen new monsters, and guidelines for creating more
An introductory adventure designed to take a party from levels 1-3


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Terra Firma
boardgame.description:
Bleeding Edge Dangers and Ancient Mysteries!

Terra Firma expands the setting of Trinity Continuum: Aeon by revealing some of the many wonders and secrets found on Earth and Luna, while also providing Storytellers with the material they require to set exciting campaigns on either of these two worlds.

Terra Firma requires both the Trinity Continuum Core Rulebook and Trinity Continuum: Aeon to play. Inside, you will find:


Further information about 10 nations previously discussed in Trinity Continuum: Aeon, including a detailed look at an important city in each nations.



Details on threats facing Earth, including revolutionary movements, dangerous cults, and criminal gangs.



An exploration of some of the strange, and often deadly, mysteries found on Earth and Luna — from the ancient and terrible Gorgon Karst caves beneath eastern Europe to the bizarre Hadley Rille Anomaly on Luna.



New technologies used on Earth, examples of the many strange and powerful relics of the Nova Age, as well as new Edges and Paths specifically for the inhabitants of Earth and Luna.


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Obscure Battles 3: Drone Commander
boardgame.description:
In Obscure Battles Volume 3 – Drone Commander, the player takes the role of a Drone Operator trying to locate and destroy enemy assets using one of the Drone Types available to player.

Unlike the other Obscure Battle Series this game is exclusively solitaire: you don’t need any other player to play the game.

Using the game rules and supplied drone, loadout, target and threat cards you can design your own drone missions !
When loading your drone, you can choose from the current set of available loadouts. Once you are airborne you also have to keep an eye on the important items such as fuel and comms and also making sure that you are not shot out of the sky.

Game comes with 2 Drones and their loadouts you can use. More drone types and loadouts are provided as part of the optional packs.

A Milk run Scenario and one U.N. peacekeeping action sample campaign is included and more is to be released along as Scenario Packs based on the current event).

Your targets are selected from a different decks of cards such VIPs figures such as Terror leaders, Warlords, Several Tank Types, Camoufledged Bunkers to take with earth penetrators, Trucks and SAMS to shoot with smart ammo using the option base and the optional extension packs provided.

Your drone will not be safe out there: there are several "well known figures" such as S400, Pantsir, Shilka, TOR, BUK, OSA SAMs, Igla and Stinger MANPADs, archaic ZU-23 Guns and even small arms (some of them are supplied on extension packs).

Your Drone can suffer malfunctions, or shot at by different threat vectors such as AA Guns,MANPADs, SAMs, Fighter Jets or even Laser guns such as Nazar...

boardgame.name: Guano! Guano!! Guano!!!
boardgame.description:
Based in 19th century American history, Guano! Guano!! Guano!!! takes players from the excrement-laden islands in the Pacific to the mansions of Newport, Rhode Island. Are you a philanthropist, an investor, or a social climber? To reach your goals, you'll have to discover new guano sources, ship it (by land or sea) to warehouses, and find the right buyers. Weather the storms, beat the competition, and enjoy the most ostentatious pastimes of the Gilded Age.

Players start with a small fleet on the way to building their guano empire. On each turn they place workers and ships to explore islands and take guano to various markets (ports). As their empire grows, players build bigger fleets and then spend their profits on luxuries of the Gilded Age.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Vengeance of the Shunned
boardgame.description:
Maghiel Will Have Her Revenge!

When the quiet village of Durgan’s Rest is rocked by a sudden explosion, the heroes discover the foul plot of a power-mad wizard who seeks to steal the might of a titan! Soon, the party is thrust into conflict with Maghiel the Shunned, a veteran of the Titanswar who seeks to rule all of Ghelspad. The shunned Drendali is willing to risk rousing the titans to achieve her aims. Can your adventurers stop her?

Over 20 community content creators have banded together to bring this full-length campaign to the Slarecian Vault! Vengeance of the Shunned takes your adventurers across Ghelspad on a quest to end the greatest threat to the world since the Titanswar!

Vengeance of the Shunned includes:

• A campaign that takes the player characters across Ghelspad
• Over 80 monsters and NPCs for Scarred Lands or any 5e setting
• New magic items and spells from the Scarred Lands
• Adventure content from some of the finest authors working on 5e compatible materials, including Beatriz T. Dias, Bill Bodden, Bryan Gillispie, Catherine Evans, Dan Layman-Kennedy, Elise Cretel, Emilie Gunderson, Jeremy Hochhalter, and Scarred Lands Line Developer Travis Legge.

boardgame.name: Downtown Farmers Market
boardgame.description:
Downtown Farmers Market takes you to your favorite time of the weekend, but today's trip might require a little bit more thinking than usual. Your task: Line up eight challenge tiles to create two axes, then place an ingredient tile at the intersection of two challenge requirements each turn.

At the end of the game, check which rows and columns have the ingredients required to complete the corresponding challenges and earn points!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 88: Planet Unknown, Witchstone, Mercado de Lisboa, Downtown Farmers Market - Top 5 Reasons We Lost

boardgame.name: Mimi Spider
Walli Laraña
Walli Wickelspinne
Walli, il ragno arraffone
Walter Wikkelspin
Web Weavers
boardgame.description:
Today, cheeky Walli and her friends are spinning big and beautiful webs. They‘re hoping for lots of juicy bugs. But what‘s that? The webs caught several treats but no bugs at all. Who would have thought it? They‘re even better than bugs! Help Walli and her friends crawl to the treats. But watch out - the spider thread gets shorter and shorter until finally the spider simply can‘t go any further.

After rolling the die to show one of 6 treats, everyone simultaneously guides their spider‘s thread through the opening of the spider web which shows the rolled treat. As soon as you cannot wind your spider through the required opening, you are out of the game. Last spider in the game wins.

boardgame.name: Aeon Aexpansion
boardgame.description:
New Equipment, New Threats, and New Heroes!

The Æon Æxpansion expands the setting of Trinity Continuum: Æon by adding wondrous new technologies, two new types of playable characters, and a variety of terrifying new opponents.

The Æon Æxpansion requires both Trinity Continuum: Æon and the Trinity Continuum Core Rulebook to play. Inside, you will find:


Information about new noetic biotech, hardtech cyberware, military weapons, and other technologies of the early 22nd century
Rules for creating and using the large and deadly battlesuits known as VARGs (Vacuum Assault and Reconnaissance Gear)
Rules for creating and playing psiad and superior characters within the Trinity Continuum
Rules for playing psions in the modern day setting of the Trinity Continuum Corebook
New and deadly Aberrants and insidious Aberrant cults for characters to battle


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Immortal Eyes: Cup of Dreams
boardgame.description:
Two decades ago, sidhe changeling Morgan Daniels watched her oathmates cross through Silver’s Gate and enter the faerie homeland of Arcadia. Now no longer a childling, Morgan hears a call, letting her know it is time for her friends to come home.

In Arcadia, Morgan’s oathmates engage in a battle to return to Morgan and the Mortal Realm they left behind. A new quest awaits them, one for the elusive and mystical Cup of Dreams.

In the meantime, drawn to San Francisco by a mysterious call, another group of changelings gathers at the Toybox Coffee Shop. Their task: defend the freehold from a series of incursions by servants of the changelings’ ancient enemies.

Combining Celtic lore with old ballads, this sequel to the Immortal Eyes Trilogy reunites old friends and brings together new ones in a tale of adventure, romance, trust and betrayal that is both timely and timeless.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Cavaliers of Mars Core Rulebook
boardgame.description:
Return now to dying Mars in its last age of glory. A world of flashing swords and choking sands, of winking courtesans and lantern-lit canal cities. Mars, where romance and heartbreak are two sides of the same obsidian chit.

Where lost cities are buried in the dunes, and dry oceans stretch out between the last daring bastions of civilization. Where the First Martians, the monument-builders, are but a faded memory. And the Red Martians have become decadent and capricious in their last days.

Find yourself digging for someone else’s treasure in the lost tombs of Chiaro, or spitting defiance at the Roundhead priests of wild Ziggur, or dashing across the towered crypts of Vance with your long-lost lover. Lock steel with the Princess Invincible, even as your hand reaches towards your flintlaser for insurance.

Cavaliers of Mars includes:
