A vibrant setting with cultures, careers, characters, and dozens of locations, all organized to get you right into the world of Mars!



An all-new system combining your character’s motivations, history, and beliefs with strategic swashbuckling action!



Astrology, crafting, psychic powers, and much more!


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Stratira Königshalma Turm
boardgame.description:
A compilation of 3 games in a wooden box, cover and bottom showing 2 of 3 boards. In addition, there is a board for Nine Men's Morris.
Components: 2 x 48 wooden blocks
Stratira: Very close to Score Four. Scoring is different as you may continue after having 4 in a row to get a better score. Details of the rules are here: https://boardgamegeek.com/thread/1466558/stratira
There are stand alone games of Stratira (to be submitted by an owner.)

Königshalma: Very close to Halma. Played on a chess board (inside and outside of the box). Necessary components: King, 2 rooks and 7 pawns in 2 colors of a chess game (not provided). 2 x 6 standard pawns (of draughts e.g.) for the 4 player game needed. The blocks of the game could do well. (Not applicable for 3 players.)
The rules for 2 players are a mix of Halma and Salta as the pawns are to be moved to their mirror space at the other end of the board. The rules say you cannot change the color of the space because otherwise it would be impossible to enter the finish spaces (which is hard to believe).

Turm: Very close to Checkers. Played on a chess board (inside and outside of the box). Start: First row is empty, the next 2 rows have all spaces occupied. Moving is forwards and sidewards only. At the finish line, the pawn will be upgraded to a "Turm", like a "King" in Checkers.

Estimated year: 1990

—user summary

boardgame.name: Ancedale's Hope
boardgame.description:
Ancedale's Hope is a print & play game for single player linking survival mechanics and science fiction universe. Survive during expeditions on an island city and return to your HQ to produce the cure to fight a dangerous virus. Survive expeditions across a hostile island city. Return to your HQ to make the cure. Ancedale's Hope is a printable game. To play it, all you need is a pencil, an eraser and 5 dice. Ideally 4 of them will be of the same color, the 5th will be of a different color.

How to play ?

Your HQ is located in a safe place near Ancedale. In this base of operations, you will create the cure by validating various objectives, prepare your expeditions but also spend your money and experience points on permanent improvements.

In Ancedale's Hope, expeditions are at the heart of the game. But beware, your time is limited, you only have 10 days to find resources, complete the various objectives and finally evacuate the island before the virus infects you too.

An expedition consists of 3 steps:


First: roll the single colored dice to find out the position of arrival on the island. Then roll 2x all 4 dice of the same color to determine the strength of the island's watchtowers
How a day unfolds: At the beginning of each day, during your expedition, roll all 5 dice. The single colored dice will determine the direction of the watchtower's view. The 4 dice of the same color will be used for your movements and for the items collected during that day. Simply note your movement on the map and mark the areas you have searched. At the end of the day you should have enough resources (food and water). In some cases you will also need to find a warm place to shelter from the cold before nightfall. If not, your health will be diminished.
At the end of an expedition: this one can be a real success or an abject failure. Fail and you will lose all the resources collected during the expedition. Succeed and you can bring them back to the safety of your HQ.

boardgame.name: Pam pam pam
boardgame.description:
Playful maths

We have created a board game that bridges the gap between school and home activities, and between learning and playing. It provides transition between age groups and people with different abilities.

It takes you from childhood to old age. It helps to move from playing alone, through playing doubles, to playing in teams. It can help children with autism to start talking. And it’s as diverse as autism.

The clarity and comprehensibility of shapes, colours and numbers can calm you down when competing.

Pam Pam Pam board game is built on values.
Pam Pam Pam rules of the game:

Pam Pam Pam is a board game in which players must find two identical symbols on the cards of a selected deck, place the colour, shape and value discs on the solution strip, and then place the solution strip next to the draw deck and name the discs.

In each deck, on each of two cards, there is only one symbol of the same colour, shape and value. A symbol is designated by colour, shape and value. The value is expressed by a number. The size of the symbols does not matter.
How the game works:

1. Players are given the basic tools.

2. Each player is dealt a card.

3. The remaining cards are placed face up in the middle. This will be the draw deck.

4. Players try to find two identical symbols on the newest card of their deck and the top card of the draw deck.

5. The first player who

a) places the discs of the correct colour, shape and value on the solution strip,

b) places it next to the draw deck,

c) names all three discs,

d) which are checked by another player, and if he/she judges them to be correct,

e) then the first player puts the discs from his/her solution strip back on the disc tray,

f) finally, he/she can pick up the card,

g) which he/she adds to his/her own cards.

If the solution is incorrect, the player takes back his /her solution strip and the round continues.

6. The game continues until all cards from the draw deck are used up.
Winner of the game:

Winner of the game is the player who has collected most of the cards.
A symbol consists of:

A colour: brown, blue, purple, red, pink, yellow, grey, green,

A shape: square, triangle, circle,

A value, e.g.: Arabic numeral, dot, finger, Roman numeral, number of two parts, a part of a number, mirrored number, vehicle, shape, letters, binary system, value of chess pieces, number of protons, number of legs of animals, combinations of these.

boardgame.name: Xeonia
boardgame.description:
Xeonia is an exciting fun anime-themed tabletop card game for 2-4 players that makes use of fast paced actions, skills, abilities, and powerful Assists to aid in becoming the champion of Xeonia!

​Play as a standalone game in a PVP (Player vs Player) game mode, or in a co-operative story campaign.

​My goal for Xeonia was to create a game that would engage the player into various combos, attacks, and skills. As I have played various card games myself, I took the ideas that stood out to me and have made them my own. With so many different combinations, the possibilities are endless.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Tiny Epic Dungeons: Official Game Mat
boardgame.description: This playmat is the perfect pairing to go alongside your Tiny Epic Dungeons game! Made from neoprene, these mats have a non slip back and are sized 26in x 26in (66cm x 66cm).

listing.notes:
Brand new copy of the game, in shrink wrap.
Shipping to EU would be 15 euro and the package should arrive in 7-10 days. Elsewhere – please ask!
Check out my other products for sale as well! If you buy multiple items, I will combine shipping costs. It’s much cheaper this way.

boardgame.name: Vivir para contarlo
boardgame.description:
Live to tell the tale is a competitive card game, in which you must come in second place to win the game.
You will represent a member of the royal council who must have knowledge of botany, politics, influences with the guilds and inhabitants of the city to achieve his best strategy, but without being the best.
The object of the game is to be the player with the second highest score.
For this, each player will start with 7 cards that will run out as the game progresses. These cards have a value from 0 to 7, they are of different suits, they contain various bonuses and in each round all players must reveal a card in their playing area.
In each round, through a draft of cards, the current starting player will decide how many cards should be passed, until the cards are finished.

boardgame.name: Guess The Fake junior
boardgame.description:
1000 amazing statements. Which is true and which is false? It’s exciting who knows what the whole family knows. Is the highly successful True or False back? board game with another release - specifically for kids! Do you believe everything? Now it turns out who is the smartest!
In the special quiz-show board game, you will hear statements from the funny presenter, and you will have to decide whether the statement is true or false. If your answer is correct, the master will reward you with a point, but if you guessed wrong, a "reward" will be deducted. The game gets twisted from round to round, so it always stays exciting and fun. Is it True or False? There are a total of 1,000 amazing statements in the memory of Junior Board Game. The game can be played by up to 5 players, but can also be practiced alone. It’s also perfect for traveling, as all you need is a star-shaped toy. Works with 3 R6 (AA) batteries included in the box.

boardgame.name: Win-Win Island
boardgame.description:
Win-Win Island is a mostly co-operative board game, where win-win deals are the key to victory!

While playing you are swept away to a beautiful island. Where more than one of you, or even all of you might win.

Each player has just been elected the leader or their town, and their goal is to make the lives of their friends and neighbors better by improving their village's standard of living, thus proving to be a leader worthy of support.

Thanks to the win-win dynamics built into the design of this game, you will find yourself able to cheer FOR your fellow players, while trading with them.

You will build your town, explore your island, help your people, and maybe even get re-elected as leader of your village.

This game was designed to allow you to play a different way with the people you love and support in real life. You can happily support them while playing too, because it is often good for you when good things happen for the other players.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Szuper Farmer Midi
boardgame.description: With the Super Farmer Midi board game, you have the opportunity to gain an insight into the life of a farm, find out what the work of farmers really is, along with the pros and cons. You can increase the number of your flock simply by rolling the dice, but you have to be on the lookout all the way because the wolf is lurking around them and can grab one of them at any time. Swap each other to collect farm animals, get at least one of each species, and become the Super Farmer! The set includes 1 rules of the game, 2 twelve-sided dice, and 128 animal pictures.

boardgame.name: Brainbox: Első állatok
BrainBox: First animals
boardgame.description: Find out as much as you can about the animals! The BrainBox - First Animals board game is a quiz game that can be played alone and by many, where everything revolves around animals. During the game, you need to draw a card and memorize as many things as possible about it. The answers on the back of the cards need to be answered correctly, and whoever knows most of the questions correctly can put the card away! The Brain Box - First Animals contains a wealth of information about animals that even younger ones can easily learn!

boardgame.name: Gockola
boardgame.description: Gockola is a fun board game in the yard of Gerzson Farm with lots and lots of pets. Everyone gets three stables and a deck of cards. Players flip through the animal cards at once and then knock down the cards they want to get ahead of each other. The goal is to be the first to populate the stables. Caution! There can only be one male in a barn and one or more females of the same species! Unwanted animals can be transported by truck, but if someone gets a faulty cow or a flying horse into their barn, they are in trouble because their animals are running away.

boardgame.name: Messina 1347: GeekyGameyGadgets Insert/Organizer
boardgame.description:
Laser cut organizer for your copy of Messina 1347.

This custom wood insert holds all the pieces for Messina 1347. Enjoy faster setup and play time with this excellent organizer.

Trays include customized engravings depicting their contents, so it's easy to see what goes where. It's a perfect fit in the original game box, allowing the game to be stored however you want: horizontally or vertically.

Arrives with all pieces punched out and ready for assembly. Does not include the game itself. Includes instructions and plenty of email support so you won't worry about encountering any issues.

boardgame.name: Bairs of the Radiant Realm
boardgame.description:
Bairs of the Radiant Realm is a two player dice placement game, where you take on the role of one of the Bears of the Air. Always looking to fly higher, further and faster, you are working to build a new aircraft. You will fly your wonderous machine across the Radiant Realm, helping its inhabitants, who will then help you in return by giving you resources or special abilities to build your new flying wonder

Developed as part of the 2022 9-Card Nanogame Print and Play Design Contest.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Greatest Treasure
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

War has come to the realm! In these dark and troubled times, the king and his council must make hard decisions on how best to preserve the kingdom. Unfortunately, this turmoil also provides opportunities for those who wish to advance their own selfish interests.

This tale is set in a typical “swords & sorcery” medieval fantasy setting and is designed for 3-5 Seasoned characters

boardgame.name: Fantasy Archetypes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is designed for home printing, and contains eight ready-to-play Savage Worlds characters, for use in most fantasy settings: Warrior, mage, cleric, rogue, ranger, paladin, druid and necromancer.

Each character has five different stat blocks, one for each rank. You can select the rank by choosing the appropriate layer in your PDF reader (a second download is available for PDF readers that don't support layers). There are also two different illustrations per character (male and female), each on a separate page, so the PDF can be printed double-sided and players can choose which side of their sheet they wish to use. Tri-fold figure flats are included on the final page.

boardgame.name: Savage Worlds Power Cards
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ooh, sweet! I got the Arcane Spike Adventure Card! What power should I cast? Fly…Invisibility–no, Intangibility!

Handy for sorting your options during combat or character creation, Savage Worlds Power Cards contain most of the important reference information about each power available from Savage Worlds core rules.

For use with Savage Worlds Adventure Edition (#SWADE).

boardgame.name: Savage Worlds Status Cards
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

My character is Bound and Distracted. …What does that mean, exactly?

Track the status of characters, Extras, and villains in the best-selling Savage Worlds roleplaying game! Included are cards for:

12 x Shaken
11 x Wounded
11 x Fatigue
5 x Distracted
5 x Vulnerable
2 x Entangled
2 x Bound
2 x Stunned
2 x Hold
1 x Aim
1 x Defend


You will also receive a PDF copy of the Status Tokens with this zip file download.

For use with Savage Worlds Adventure Edition (#SWADE).

boardgame.name: Superclub: Top Six Expansion Pack
boardgame.description: More players, more managers, more everything. With the Superclub expansion, Top Six, expand your game for the ultimate experience. Discover purple utility players that can play multiple positions equally well, super talents that can be developed from 1 to 6 stars, two brand new clubs that allow you to play 6 at a time, and much more. Superclub expansion requires base game to play, skills to win, and nothing more than a pulse to thoroughly enjoy.

boardgame.name: Arena: The Contest – Tanares Character Pack
boardgame.description: Featuring the 4 new species (Taii’maku, Cirrus, Gloomfolk, Kemet), a Lost Magic Researcher (Kelanyah, the Wizard), and M’bollo, a Courage Domain Cleric, complete the Adventure Team introduced in the sample and play in any scenario with highly-detailed miniatures. The box also comes with new Item Cards for Tanares Adventures to represent each race’s signature equipment, and more!

boardgame.name: Superclub: Arsenal 2021/22
boardgame.description: Arsenal join the competition, finally allowing you to take charge of your favorite team in a game of Superclub! Scout, sign and develop all your favorite players as you try to maneuver the Gunners up the table in search of the coveted 100-points season.

boardgame.name: Superclub: Man City 2021/22
boardgame.description: Reigning Premier League champions Manchester City join the Superclub competition. Have fun scouting, signing and developing all your favorite players in direct competition with your closest rivals. Can you replicate what the Citizens achieved in 2017/18 by masterminding a Superclub worthy 100-points season? Only time will tell.

boardgame.name: Arena: The Contest – Tanares Villains Pack
boardgame.description: Tanares is home to powerful monsters and intelligent villains who have been executing their nefarious plans for centuries. Find several of them and their gold-sized Villain/Overlord Cards, containing instructions, abilities, and Stats related to the missions from Arena: the Contest’s Epic Campaign, in this pack.

boardgame.name: Arena: The Contest – Tanares Penumbral Pack
boardgame.description: The Penumbral Plane is one of Tanares's signature environments, a dark mirror of reality, where the most horrific Tanarean aberrations dwell, embodying dark emotions and negative thoughts. Face the powerful, huge penumbral dragon in Adventure in the Realms of Madness or join his side on Dragon Collection's Boss v Boss Game Mode. The monsters all come with stat block cards and are tne most powerful villains we've designed for Tanares Adventures, as you'll face them in the new (Epic) campaign arc.

boardgame.name: Arena: The Contest – Tanares Mystical Pack
boardgame.description: Get two new Heroes (Emperor and Harun), Assets, and representatives of our new Simple Classes!

boardgame.name: Arena: The Contest – The Gold Dragon
boardgame.description: Get the masterfully-sculpted GARGANTUAN miniature of Isendden, the Gold Dragon! The box + tray also includes a Bosspad, Talisman Card, and 5x Attack Cards to play the Dragon Collection's Boss v Boss Game Mode.

boardgame.name: Cepheus Journal (Issue 010)
boardgame.description:
From the website description

We have a couple of articles again from Jo Jaquinta, the first one exploring rare metals and minerals, as well as one on a quirky design of the space junk – including a deck plan. Plus, he’s given us the fourth episode of his fiction story ‘The Raiders Lament’.

Our own Paul Drye has written an expansion of a Sword of Cepheus role, the Alchemist, with lots of potion information to give some zing to your fantasy games. Norton Glover gives us an adventure for Zaibatsu for 3 to 6 players that’s sure to challenge your street samurai.

Jon F. Zeigler outlines ‘The Human Destiny’, a space opera setting of his own devising. We have two articles from our own P-O Bergstedt about online AI tools and world generation in the Hostile Setting. Finally, Brett Kruger round out this issue with a teaser for a setting he is working on.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Bring Me the Head of Izumi Takahiro
Using AI for your Cepheus Engine Setting
World Generation in the Hostile Setting
boardgame.rpg: Zaibatsu: Roleplaying the Corporate Wars of the Future

boardgame.name: The Curse of Illmoore Bay
boardgame.description:
A new and original 16 bit game heavily inspired by Saturday morning cartoons from the 90s fueled by our deep love for the SEGA Genesis / Mega Drive Console.

A horizontal scrolling action platformer that will take you through six different worlds each with it's own monsters and bosses, with tons of items to collect and powerful abilities to acquire.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Arena: The Contest – Tanares Penumbral Tarrasque
boardgame.description:
Face this GARGANTUAN for in an Epic adventure!

This is the ultimate final boss fight!

boardgame.name: Joking Hazard: Dating Hazard
boardgame.description: A Joking Hazard 10-card pack expansion available as a GameFound exclusive for backing Master Dater.

boardgame.name: Master Dater: Uncut
boardgame.description: 150 New Cards that are too hot to handle.

boardgame.name: The Heart of Cthulhu: Father Dagon Mystery Deck
boardgame.description: This is a new stand alone deck of 110 cards that can be seamlessly added to the original game. This deck adds new elements of mystery and mechanisms for fighting other players. This deck costs 5 integrity to draw from and is full of card types from the original 3 decks but introduces new mystery cards that make the game change dramatically.

boardgame.name: Match a Track
boardgame.description: Players demonstrate their animal track identification skills in in this card game. Player take turns matching tracks to animals. Guess are checked against a reference sheet. The player who can match the most tracks to the correct corresponding animals wins.

boardgame.name: Ticket To Ride: Italia – Commemorazione Per il Centenario del Milite Ignoto 1921 - 2021
boardgame.description:
Edition issued by Asmodee with the authorization of Days of Wonders and the Italian Ministry of Defense. Non-saleable Commemorative Copy released in very few copies for the Lucca Comics & Games 2021 event to commemorate "The Centenary of the Unknown Soldier". In symbolic honor to all the Italian soldiers who fell and dispersed in the war. Includes Graphic changes on the map in honor of the Italian Ministry of Defense and 4 new destination maps containing the cities of AQUILEIA and LUCCA

Edizione rilasciata da Asmodee con l'autorizzazione di Days of Wonders e il Ministero della Difesa Italiano. Copia Commemorativa non vendibile rilasciata in pochissime copie per l'evento Lucca Comics & Games 2021 per commemorare "Il Centenario del Milite Ignoto" . In onore simbolico a tutti i soldati italiani caduti e dispersi in guerra. Include Modifiche grafiche sulla mappa in onore del Ministero della Difesa Italiano e 4 Carte destinazione nuove contenenti le città di AQUILEIA e LUCCA
boardgame.boardgameversion: Commemorazione Per il Centenario del Milite Ignoto 1921 - 2021 (not saleable)

boardgame.name: Four Score
boardgame.description:
Four Score combines strategy and dexterity in a multidimensional space. Use wooden sticks to complete lines of four on both sides of the board to win. To claim victory at Four Score you will need a steady hand, a keen eye for blocking and a passion for strategy.

Our board has a modular, minimalist design and all game components are wooden, sustainable and environmentaly friendly.

Four Score has four rules:

Red plays first and can play only on outer holes for their first move.
To win, you must complete a line of four on both sides of the board. Horizontal, vertical or diagonal will do the trick


﻿# Sticks can only be controlled from your side of the board (no reaching in to the centre of the board to complete your move)
﻿# If you dislodge a stick on your go, that stick is replaced and your turn is over
﻿Final note: in the rare event of a stalemate, if one player has competed a line of four on 1 side they are declared the winner

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Quaking Aspens
boardgame.description:
Quaking aspen is a species of trees that often propagates through its roots to form large, clonal colonies that all share a single root system. In this game, you will play as an aspen tree, spreading its roots to grow clones in order to become the best grove of Quaking Aspens.

The active player rolls all three dice and then claims one of those dice. The player to their left will then claim one of the remaining two dice. All other players (if any) will use the final die.
Each player will then use their die value to connect a leaf to another, already circled leaf (or the start leaf). They will do this by finding a solid path containing their die value leading from a circled leaf to another leaf, drawing a line over the path, and circling the new leaf.
Each time a player circles a leaf, they gain the benefit of that leaf, which will either be a bonus or a scoring opportunity. These benefits will be tracked on your tracking mat.
The game will be played in rounds, with all players taking simultaneous turns, until a single player has reached any 4 of the goal leaves. All players will finish the current round and then proceed to scoring.

boardgame.name: Beaches for the Brave: A Solitaire Wargame
boardgame.description:
Beaches for the Brave is a very light dice placement/allocation solitaire game which loosely represents the beach landings in Normandy and the Pacific Islands by Allied forces during World War Two. Each landing is designed to be small-scale and represents perhaps one or two boats landing on specific sections of the beaches. The various landings represented try to reflect some of the actual situations and events as they happened, but this is meant to be an accessible game which is quick and easy to play and so it is not a complex simulation. Players will still be challenged by the conditions and the enemy, so expect a tough time out there!

There are 12 beaches in the game, including Utah, Gold, Juno, Omaha, Sword, Pointe du Hoc, Iwo Jima and Tarawa. You will need to add six or seven standard dice, and either a pencil and eraser or some basic tokens (a dozen or so will be enough).

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: 0-100 Orange
boardgame.description:
A trivia game where you have to answer with a number ranging from 0 to 100. One question could be "How many states does the United States of America consist of?"
One player decides to go with the answer of 50. The second player answers 54.
The player who answered 50 gets a -10 score because he/she got it right, whilst the second player gets a score of 4 (i.e. the difference from his/hers answer to the correct answer).
The game is played in three rounds, consisting of seven questions each.
The player with the lowest score at the end of the game is the winner.
1085 unique questions.

boardgame.name: La Frontera
boardgame.description:
La Frontera is a co-operative game for two players in which one player represents the migrants, a group of people who for different reasons have had to leave their country and seek to settle elsewhere. The other player takes on the role of an NGO whose mission is to facilitate the entry of migrants. Both players must work together, taking care of their confidential information, so that the greatest number of migrants reach the Residence, avoiding bureaucratic, political, social, and economic obstacles before it's too late.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Smart10: Fotbolls-EM
boardgame.description: Fifty new cards with 100 new questions and 1,000 new answers about the European Football Championship.

boardgame.name: Grinderbin's Mobile Market of Ridiculous Magic Items
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:
As a gamemaster, giving your players magic items feels good. As a player, getting them feels good too. But too often the items, canon or homebrew, are either so dull they collect dust in the player’s inventory - or worse, so overpowered you risk upsetting the balance between players or the entire narrative of your campaign.

In an ocean of +1 Swords of Genericism, Grinderbin's Mobile Market of Ridiculous Magic Items is a collection of over 120 strange and unique magic items designed to be fun for players without breaking your game. Both quirky and quick to put into play, every piece of armor, weapon, tool, and hovering donkey is created and curated to inspire—and require—the creativity of everyone at the table.

There’s nothing as dull as a Froststone Maul or as dangerous as the Deck of Ruining Campaigns in Grinderbin’s shop. These items invite players to interact with them regularly in all aspects of the game. That enables you, the Gamemaster, to give them out frequently and get the joy of seeing your players smile. Their quirks and oddities are a feature, not a bug: fun enough for a little side-quest or just to add unique flavor to an existing narrative within your world.

What do you say? Up for a bit of adventure with your purchase?

boardgame.name: Habitats: Component Upgrades
boardgame.description:
92 upgraded components to replaces cardboard components from the base game:

76 unique animals
12 gates
4 camps

boardgame.name: Die Kolonisten
boardgame.description:
The players alternately place a cardboard strip, beginning with the double red bordered harbor square, which must be filled first; this is followed by the 5 squares of the port city, then the 3 of the track. When all of these squares are closed, each player can place his strips anywhere on the board. Exceptions are the gold fields marked with a red dashed border, which may only be occupied when the red border of the mountain squares surrounding them is occupied. Furthermore, the inner lines of the farms may only be occupied when the red border is completely closed.

As often as a player manages to close a square with four of his stripes, he may place markers of his color in this square, namely 2 markers each in the port city, on the railway line and on the mountains, 3 on the red-bordered farms, on the gold fields 5, on all other squares one each.

If a player succeeds in enclosing a small group of fewer than 16 of his opponents stripes in such a way that he can no longer establish a connection with a group nearby, he can remove these stripes and the latter may not occupy these lines again.

When all lines are occupied or one of the players can no longer place a strip, the game is over. Whoever has placed the most markers is the winner.

boardgame.name: Night of the Gray Death
boardgame.description:
[From the back of the package]
A night to remember. Bring horror and conspiracy to life at your table with this double-sided, full-color Flip-Mat featuring key encounter locations from the Pathfinder Second Edition adventure Night of the Gray Death on either side! One side depicts an eerie ballroom and the other side details a crumbled vault. Spend less time sketching and more time playing. With Pathfinder Flip-Mat: Night of the Gray Death, intrigue awaits!

Pathfinder Flip-Mat: Night of the Gray Death measures 24" x 30" unfloded and 8" x 10" folded. Usable by experienced GMs and novices alike, Pathfinder Flip-Mats fit perfectly into any Game Master's arsenal!

boardgame.name: Combat Companion
boardgame.description:
Within this book will be found a huge number of optional rules, new additions and new ideas to add into an existing or new AFF Campaign, and useful for both Player and Director. Within you will find:


Alternative Hero creation for novice/experienced characters
Four new Special Skills
Twelve new Talents
New Critical and Fumble tables
Ten Alternative combat rules
Twelve new Combat Options
Martial Arts rules and nine styles
New Combat Magic school
Seventeen new Spells
Master and Acquired Magic weapons and armour
New weapons, armour and equipment
Mounted combat rules and new mounts
Twenty Three Monster Templates


Don’t let those flashy spellcasters grab all of the glory! Buckle on your swordbelt, grab your trusty shield and find glory in battle!

- from the back cover

boardgame.name: Tåg till Rydsgård, Skåne (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
boardgame.description: Tåg till Rydsgård, Skåne is a fan-made expansion for the Days of Wonder board game Ticket to Ride. It is a partially almost entirely correct reproduction of existing, or previously existing, train lines in the southern-most part of Sweden (Scania and its closest neighbours).

boardgame.name: Rescue at Mt Etna
boardgame.description:
A daring rescue mission! During a regular hiking trip, Mt. Etna suddenly becomes active. The access road is blocked and hikers are trapped. Your mission: fly your helicopters into the volcano to rescue the hikers before the advancing lava reaches them.

This game stresses crisis planning, risk-taking, and cooperation. Three separate lava advances are controlled by dice, and hikers run from the advancing lava. Some locations in the volcano are easier to land in than others. Eventually the lava will fill the crater, and any hikers trapped will perish. Pilots who crash into the volcano must also be rescued. It is a race against the lava!

Players use dice to simulate the difficulty of flying in tricky conditions. Helicopters can be upgraded with power-ups and individual pilot cards grant special abilities. The overall victory is cooperative, but points are also awarded individually for a best pilot award.

This is a great game for introducing the importance of cooperation, teamwork, and risk taking in life-and-death situations. The situation is simulated but tension is real.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Ed & Wolf
boardgame.description:
Ed and Wolf accidentally invent a magic potion that turns the plants into moving, talking creatures. From that moment on, their new friends need special elements to stay alive. Every night, Ed and Wolf sneak out to gather all the important ingredients. The time is short and the locations can only be revealed one by one. Help them in their nighttime quest: find everything the plants need and return to Ed's room before it is too late!

—description from the publisher

The players have to consider every movement and situation as a puzzle to solve. The goal is to cross the garden, walk through the house, moving from one tile to another, meanwhile you have to spare your Time Cards, collect special ingredients and save as many plants as you can. …and: return to Ed’s room before your Time Cards run out.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Mutant Chronicles 3rd Edition Core Book Savage Worlds Edition
boardgame.description:
Mutant Chronicles takes you on a full-throttle diesel-punk ride through a solar system beset by corporate intrigue and the invasion of the Dark Legion. With technology failing due to the insidious effects of the Dark Symmetry, mankind must fight back against the Dark Legion hordes whilst dealing with in-fighting and conspiracy.

Now, in this Savage Worlds Edition of the definitive techno-fantasy roleplaying game, you can play during the early days of the Dark Symmetry, through to the brutal Corporate Wars. Investigate foul cults as technology turns against mankind, or fight the armies of the Dark Legion as they pour forth from citadels across the colonies in the battle for humanity’s future.

• Rules for character creation, including the new Lifepath Edge mechanic to define your character based on one of the iconic archetypes of the setting.

• Master the Art of Light taught by the Brotherhood, or be drawn into the Dark Symmetry, and taste the power that comes from Heresy.

• Equipment, powers, and custom rules reinforce the grittiness of this exciting techno-noir setting.

• Never-before-seen secrets of the Mutant Chronicles universe, and maps of the solar system and LunaCity.

• Insight in to the Dark Legion Apostles and their unique forces, tactics and plots, along with full stats for new and old monstrosities.

• Briefings on the major corporations, Imperial, Bauhaus, Capitol, Mishima, and Cybertronic, as well as the Cartel, the Brotherhood, and Whitestar. Guide to running adventures during the rise of the Dark Symmetry and first wars through to the return of the Dark Legion.

THIS BOOK REQUIRES THE SAVAGE WORLD EXPLORERS OR DELUXE EDITION.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Gettysburg Solitaire
boardgame.description:
Take command of the Confederate army at the battle of Gettysburg in an original bookgame by Worthington Publishing. Refight the bloody 1st and 2nd of July as you try to break the Union defenses at Cemetery Hill, Culps Hill, and Little Round Top.

You receive 12 battle plays for July 1st and 12 battlesfor July 2nd. July 1 is the easier of the two days as you try to crush the I and XI corps and drive the Union army from Gettysburg. July 2, the battle gets tougher as you have to fight through Devil’s Den and Little Round Top, and the Union reserves coming from Culps Hill.

All you need to provide is a die, a pen, and a sense of adventure to play.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Brazil: Imperial – reDrewno Insert
Brazil: Świt Imperium – reDrewno Insert
boardgame.description: Insert for Brazil: Imperial. It fits cards in premium sleeves.

boardgame.name: Marvel HeroClix: Marvel Studios' What If…? Miniatures Game
boardgame.description:
Experience the events of Marvel Studios What If…? like never before in this smash hit Miniatures Game standalone experience. “What If…?” flips the script on the MCU, reimagining famous events from the films in unexpected ways! Play with your favorites such as Captain Carter, T’Challa Star-Lord, and Party Thor!

Play up to 8 campaign scenarios unique to this Miniatures game for 2 players where results matter from session to session or sit down for a head-to-head single match of raw power! Each of the 10 beautiful ready to play figures comes with two different ways to play for hundreds of different combinations. Excellent point of entry for the first-time miniatures player! Map components are thick double-sided tiles and the box includes everything you need to play!

This miniatures game contains everything 2 people need to play HeroClix:

A meaty multi-session campaign for 2 players that pivots and turns based on the results of the last session
10 Premium Quality Pre-Painted Miniatures each with TWO ways to play for beginner or advanced play
20 Character Cards (one each for beginner and advanced versions)
18 Object, Terrain, and Bystander tokens
8 Campaign Scenario Cards
6 Double-Sided Thick Map Tiles. No folds!
2 Custom six-sided dice with an icon of The Watcher
2 All-new Powers and Abilities Cards with Marvel Studios What If…? imagery
1 Full-Color HeroClix Core Rulebook (2022 edition)

This boxed-set is a great way for 2 players to learn HeroClix or just enjoy a themed gaming experience! Existing players will definitely want to pick up this product to play with their friends or at tournaments!

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Air Sloop
boardgame.description:
In Air Sloop you play the role of the captain of a sleek and fast air ship called an Air Sloop. You will travel to acquire goods which you use to fulfill orders and earn gold. The Air Sloop Captain with the most at the end of the game is the winner.

Air Sloop is played over several rounds.
Each round consists of each captain taking one turn.
Each captain performs one action each turn.
Turns proceed clockwise, beginning with the starting captain.

Core Loop

When it is your turn, you must do one of the following actions:

MOVE: Choose one column in your cargo hold. Pilot your air sloop to adjacent districts based on the number of open spaces in the column you choose. Take goods from each district you visit. You may not visit the same district twice during one turn. Captains may also land on a contract card to (fulfill)

BUY: Use gold to buy a stock

End of Game

The end of the game is triggered once one captain has exchanged gold for their THIRD (3rd) AND FINAL CONTRACT CARD.

All captains then take turns so that all captains have an equal number of turns.

Determining a Winner

The winner is the captain who has the most gold. Total gold is calculated by totaling up the following:


The total gold earned by the captain.
The cost of each contract card bought by the captain.
Gold earned by cargo remaining in a cargo hold by the text on the captain’s bought contract cards.

boardgame.name: Items for Social Encounters
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Combat, exploration and social interaction are the three pillars of adventure, but have not always been equally represented in magic item tables. This supplement contains 51 listings of items for social encounters to redress the balance.

boardgame.name: Items of the Ancients 2
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

More magical items inspired by Dota 2.

boardgame.name: Koa's Horticulture Guide
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Sixty-nine unique herbs, plants, and mushrooms to fill your fantastical world with fantastical flora.

boardgame.name: One Hundred Magical Herbs
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A d100 list of magical herbs and plants, along with their intended effects for your fantasy world.

boardgame.name: Magical Plants: An Adventurer's Guide to Botany
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This guide allows D&D players to find magical plants out in the world, whether it's in the depths of a jungle or among the collections of a Hag. This file explains how to use magical plants in your campaign and includes a long table with 100 random magical plant effects.

boardgame.name: Mechanical Dream Introduction
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In this brief introduction to Mechanical Dream, you will learn about the inhabitants of Naakinas & Kainas, the 10 races sharing a living space on a dual ecosystem universe.

You will about about these races, from which are born Echoes - Heroes who can grow to extreme levels of power. You will learn how they cope with an ever shifting reality, how they manage to stabilize it, and how they live with the Dream (the "Nocturne"). You willl learn about Orpee, the food of survival, and how this incredibly rough universe somehow manages to be survived through wits and courage, be it in the incredibly huge City-States built on mile high trees, or in the wilderness, fighting beasts from a bygone era!

boardgame.name: Meowmagic Spell Lists and Descriptions
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A compiled version of "meow magic" spells released for various previous editions of the game, revised for 5th edition. Despite the name, the spells are not necessarily focused on cats or animals.

boardgame.name: Monster Loot - The Wild Beyond the Witchlight
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

When brave adventurers face the dangers of the world, they want something to show for it. This supplement provides individual loot for each monster appearing in The Wild Beyond the Witchlight, as well as a basic crafting and harvesting system.

With this supplement, these brave adventurers will be able to craft the hide, teeth, and claws of their enemies into dangerous weapons and equipment that is sure to mark them as legendary heroes of the realm.

boardgame.name: Potions Unlocked
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Legendary potions, fantastical plants, optional rules, and adventure hooks for any campaign!

User summary:

The PDF document is distributed with a .ZIP archive of maps.

boardgame.name: Return of the Necromancer
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Undead servants, nasty traps, and hidden secrets. You can sharpen your blade. You can prepare your spells. But can you survive the horrors in the catacombs?

A one-shot mini adventure

boardgame.name: The Sha'ir
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

“I WISH for a class like no other!”

Now Available: The Sha’ir Class by Campaign & Craft.

What is a Sha’ir?

Masters of the Elements:

The Sha’ir have an innate mastery of the elements, one that allows them to communicate with, command and even bind the essence and emissaries of each elemental plane, whether they be minor gen elementals, or incredibly powerful genie lords.

Planar Gatekeepers, Guards and Guides:

Sha’ir are planar travellers capable of creating doorways between the elemental planes and our own material plane. Some Sha’ir use these powers to capture, enslave and coerce elemental beings into servitude to increase their power. Whilst other Sha’ir act as protectors of these planar gates, to stop others tampering or toying with powers beyond their understanding.

Thieves of Magical Secrets:

Sha’ir are tricksters known for their clever natures and devious exploits. Many wizards, sorcerers and other spellcasters fear and avoid these arcane swindlers for their ability to steal magical secrets from their minds without a trace.

Art of the Deal:

The Sha’ir are often compared to fiendish entities from the Nine-Hells, as they possess an exquisite finesse for contracts, deals and politics that allows them to parley with the ancient and powerful forces of the elemental planes. As a result, most Sha’ir have extensive experience dealing with the elemental planes and the genies lords therein, thus, they are favoured diplomats and emissaries to the planar realms.

Al-Qadim & Your Setting

The Sha’ir is a class inspired by, but not limited to the Al-Qadim setting and the class of the same name from Dungeons & Dragons 3.5. This class is a labour of love that has been play tested extensively within my own campaign over a period of two years. The class can be incorporated with relative ease into any existing campaign providing the elemental planes exist and can be interacted with in some small way.

Included In this Document:

Unique Level 1 – 20 Class Features:

A Unique twist on the common spell caster that features a percentile-based spell theft system, fate dice, cosmic containers, elemental familiars and portals.

3 Awesome subclasses:

The Way of the Martial:

A Sha’ir that follows the Way of the Martial trains extensively to manipulate elemental magic as part of their fighting style, learning to strike down their enemies using elementally infused weaponry.

The Way of the Master:

A Sha’ir that follows the Way of the Master coerces and enslaves elemental gen and genie, forcing them to bend to their wishes, so that they can mould reality to the whims and fancies.

The Way of the Mind:

A Sha’ir that follows the Way of the Mind focusses on exercising their mind and training their memory, dedicating themselves to a life of study in order to unravel the many secrets of the arcane.

Elemental Familiars:

The Sha’ir document includes 8 original minor elemental stat blocks of varying challenge ratings, including earth, air, water, fire, ooze, ash, magma and ice. These minor elementals were created to act as Gen familiar for your character, aiding them in fetching spells and fighting alongside them on the battlefield.

Detailed Art:

The document includes 18 pieces of custom art, including stylized minor elementals, full page cover art, sub-class art and ability / feature art, all lovingly created by Zach Hendershott to help inspire the creation of your own characters and convey the general class aesthetic.

Tables and Tips:

Finally, the document includes a number of tables and tips to help to aid the Dungeon Master, such as providing examples for what to do on a success or failure when a Sha’ir attempts to steal a spell, or when creating custom elementals, binding a new elemental familiar, offering aesthetical changes to a character based on their gen familiar, or including spell scroll complications.

boardgame.name: The Dreaming Rooms of the Sphinx
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This adventure comprises a room with a musical puzzle and a second room with a sequence of riddles attached to combat encounters. It can be run as a one shot or the rooms can be used as modular parts of any dungeon in want of puzzles.

Run time is likely in the 2-3 hour range. Giving clues, cutting the number of summoned combatants and dropping a riddle or two should allow you to trim the length as you go. Scaling notes are provided to adjust the encounters for parties of different levels.

The Dreaming Rooms of the Sphinx

Sekhemib the Dreamer (Big Sezz to his mates) is just a hard working sphinx in a mean old world. He's a real self starter, whatever that means. With his own two front paws he's built his business from nothing into one of the leading architectural firms in the planes. He even works nights, designing puzzles and riddles in his dreams. Lately there's been a bit of a hold up there. His employees are supposed to solve his dreams, while he gets a good night's sleep, but this time they just can't quite cut the mustard. Big Sezz could probably lucid dream and solve them himself, but leadership means delegation, so it's time to call in the independent contractors.

boardgame.name: Sorcerer Unlimited
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sorcerer Unlimited is a supplement for Dungeons and Dragons 5th edition revolving specifically around the Sorcerer and the lack of identity or unique spells they receive.

In order to hopefully adjust for this, Play Your Role has worked with a few friends to create a supplement that should add options to any Sorcerers at your table without drastically changing the class like many other homebrewed options tend to do.

In this supplement you will find new Sorcerer specific spells, cantrips, and a new type of spell known as ‘tempermental’, made to make the Sorcerer feel as if they are truly a well spring of magic ready to unleash at a moments notice.

boardgame.name: Revel's End: Prison Break
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the northern reaches of Icewind Dale lies an infamous prison situated on the frigid coast of the Sea of Moving Ice. One of the prisoners is the sole keeper of a devastating secret, the location of [spoilers for Rime of the Frostmaiden]. In order to end the Everlasting Rime, all options are on the table, including the prison break of a notorious criminal... Prisoner 237.

Revel's End Prison Break is a short guide on:

Storytelling. How to make Revel's End a meaningful story location for Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden with the breakout of Prisoner 237.

Adventuring. How to facilitate an exciting one-shot prison break for your players at Revel's End

User summary:

Requires the use of Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden.

boardgame.name: Mother Haggle's Notice Board
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Mother Haggle is an elderly crone who runs a Lost & Found Emporium on the edge of the Misty Forest. The old lady pays her mercenaries well, and attracts all kinds of talent to send on her various errands. Mother Haggle doesn't deal in world shaking problems, but it's uncanny how often simple tasks like "fetch that cow" or "bring me a boggle" end in embarrassment, grievous injury or death. As she always says, it really can't be helped. Using the streamlined Plausible Complications and Unlikely Disasters layout, Mother Haggle's adventures are one-sheet wonders ready to pick up and play with groups of the specified level.

User summary:

This is an expanded version of Mother Haggle's Notice Board: Omnibus.

boardgame.name: Traveler's Guide to the Cosmos
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to the Cosmos - a vast open-world adventure sourcebook for your interstellar 5e campaigns. This book provides a strong foundation for galactic adventures using rules designed to minimally impact the 5e core rules. Design your own starship, fight enemies, and venture into unexplored territory in the Galaxy. Embrace technomancy in a world where magic powers everything piece of technology.

boardgame.name: Azure Lane Jumpchain
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You will experience great tales of tragedy, heroism, camaraderie, and, and, wild fits of laughter… Ok, let’s be honest here, Jumper. You’re here for the Ship-girls, or more power. So let’s cut with the frippery and get right down to business.

boardgame.name: 船内に謎の生命反応アリ! Creature Reaction Inside the Ship!
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A century and a half ago humans finally reached the stars, opening up a whole new world to them as they explored, looted and established commerce. Many kinds of people rushed into the depths of space to chase the new opportunities granted to them. Corporate agents, pirates, police officers and even independent contractors and explorers.

People like a certain busty female hunter-for-hire.

boardgame.name: Drainage City Jump
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the Drainage City, the metropolis beneath. The city above is significantly advanced, comparable to most toku settings with its total-conversion cyborg soldiers and strange human remodeling experiments. Of course most of the stuff is kept hidden on the surface, so where do the demons ,the human-animal hybrids, the freaks robots and obvious cyborg monsters make their homes? In the city below! Down in the endless labyrinth of massive flood canals, sewers, forgotten sub basements and various forms of catacombs the city beneath the city thrives off the waste of the city above power, water, scrap everything discarded and lost from the city above comes down here. Anyone can come here willingly, seldom do they as long as we have a choice.

boardgame.name: Feeder Fantasy Jumpchain
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the peaceful little town of Mordau. Now, generally I'd say that you've arrived late to the party. I emphasize that the land is presently at peace, a lasting one, as a trio of heroines defeated the 'Demon Lord' long before you arrived, and all three have settled down in Mordau to enjoy the peace they fought so hard for. Sounds simple and sweet, doesn't it? A nice little, relaxing belay...

boardgame.name: Generic QQ
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

QQ: a forum where lewdness is accepted, embraced, groped, and then fucked. As a Jumper, you will be a member of this forum for the next ten years. Or else. If you get banned, you fail the jump. Fortunately, you don’t have to worry about other forms of jump failure, as you have heavy plot armor to protect you from everything except the site mods.

boardgame.name: Generic Soul Master Jump
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Battle Duel: Soul Master is a Lewd Card Game style Quest started by brop on Fiction.live that spawned several Spin-offs. Because most of these Quests don’t last long their individual lore isn’t really substantial enough to justify individual Jumps, so I decided to just mash them together and form one Generic Soul Master Jump for all the Jumpers out there.

boardgame.name: Horny Horror
}{Horny Horror}{
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Generic Monster Fucker Jumpchain

“Somewhere, out there, is a woman who sees some wretched, writhing thing at the bottom of her basement stairs. Rather than fear, when it answers to her interrogations she feels as if she’s never been so excited.

In a world of magic and fantasy the princess of a fair kingdom has been stolen away by a terrifying dragon. A brave knight has been sent to deal with the beast, but they have other plans for the dragon other than slaying.

In another time, a routine mechanic for a remote piloted space hulk feels her isn’t alone. If reports are to be believed some form of predatory alien might be stalking the vents. Is it the hunter though, or is it being hunted?

If you’re stepping foot in this world you likely share one thing with the protagonists of these stories, you’re a monster fucker.

At least you’re not alone, right?

boardgame.name: Huniepop
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Why, hello there cutie! My name is Kyu, Love Fairy extraordinaire and your Benefactor has asked me to run you through your options before you enter this world. It’s quite an interesting world with aliens and cat girls hiding in plain sight. Interesting enough that beings like my boss have been paying attention to it for a long time, but the most exciting part in my humble opinion is just how many attractive girls make the place their home. And I’m talking girls of all types, adorable virgins, sexy milfs, bratty shortstacks, this place has it all. I can see you’re excited already, but there’s a few things we need to figure out before I send you off on your way.

boardgame.name: Ikusa Otome Valkyrie
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The world is filled with demons and monsters. The only ones who can stand against the forces of darkness are the battle maidens of Odin. The story has been repeated over and over. Whether you are one of the Valkyries or part of the forces of darkness you will most likely spend ten years in this world.
